Whining a bit, Akamaru pondered for just a moment, then stopped as he looked back at the boy and grinned a bit to himself as he hopped back up to the booths seat and turned to Kiba. Okay, I MIGHT have an idea...and it MIGHT work...but we're gonna have to be a little quick on our feet about this, otherwise that big tip we're leaving is gonna be a LOT bigger...

Looking back at Akamaru uncertainly, Kiba gulped nervously and rested his hands against his tummy protectively. "Akamaru...? W-what are you up to...?" Kiba asked with some doubt as the dog leaned in and licked the boy's face assuredly before hopping down under the table and towards the one leg of the table bolted to the ground. Okay, soon as you have enough room to move, scoot your butt as far as you can before any damage is done to the table....or me...

"Ummmm...are you sure that's a good idea, boy?" Kiba asked, even more nervously. Akamaru whined to himself. This is a lot of things, Kiba, but a good idea is not one of them. Still, we gotta at least try something, right? Okay, ready? However reluctant, Kiba nodded as Akamaru immediately pushed with all his canine might against the poll holding the table together. Some more patrons looked at the scene, a little more than dumbfounded, none more so than their waiter. Akamaru struggled a bit as he pushed against the poll more and more with a surprising amount of strength, until with a great sensation of relief, Kiba's belly was no longer getting clamped down by the table.

Wasting no time at all, the boy scooted for his life until he stumbled out of the booth, clutching his sore belly with sweet relief. Seeing this, Akamaru immediately stopped pushing and moved away from the table's poll before he could snap it off the ground. Unfortunately, he didn't anticipate the plates atop the table, one of which he watched; almost in futile slow motion, tumble off the table, and almost come crashing down to the ground. Luckily, their waiter dove into action and caught the plate before it could crash against the floor and cause any more commotion.

Watching, Akamaru smiled happily, actually kind of impressed. Wow, good catch! Chuckling a bit sheepishly, Kiba winced nervously and said, "Ehhh...s-sorry about that." Sighing to himself, the waiter placed the plate atop the table and; despite himself, smirked at the boy and ruffled his head. "Eh, it's alright, kid," he said. Rubbing the back of his head, Kiba grinned then paid for his meal, as well as leaving a more than generous tip for their waiter as both the boy and the dog took their leave.

Resting his hands against his more than bloated tummy, Kiba sighed as he and Akamaru sluggishly made their way down the road. "Ooof, oh man, I tell ya, boy, I dunno how far I'm gonna get on this gut," he said, patting his belly for emphasis, causing it and his inverted navel to wobble a bit. Akamaru barked both happily and wearily, barely able to get by on his own bloated tummy. Heh, tell me about it...

As the two try to get by...
115331122212222122112212121.title: "...I think I'm wedged into the booth..."

1153311222122221221122121211.content:
It didn't take long for the two of them to realize that, with their stomachs being the way they were, there was no way they'd be able to make their way back home until they'd shrunk down to a manageable state.

"Besides," Kiba groaned, wincing as he staggered along, cradling his belly, "I really don't want my mom seeing me like this..."

Akamaru whined in response. Yeah, and I don't want her chewing me out for letting you stuff yourself....again...

Kiba shuddered. "I hear ya, Akamaru, but where can we go? The training ground's a good way off, and it's not like we can lay down on any benches or anything like that..."

Yeah, Akamaru sighed, shaking his head. To be honest, I don't really know where... The dog suddenly trailed off, looking off into the distance. Curious, Kiba tilted his head at his buddy. "Eh? What's up, boy?"

The dog barked, wagging his tail. I think I might have just found the answer to our little problem.

Confused, but nonetheless intrigued, Kiba followed his friend's gaze, his face lighting up when he saw what his pal was indicating: specifically, a nicely-sized park, with lots of green grass and a couple of trees, perfect for napping against. There were some villagers there, but it wasn't like they'd never seen him stuffed before. "Nice eye, boy!" Grinning, he stumbled over to Akamaru, resting his arm on the dog. "Think you can manage?"

Akamaru woofed happily, licking Kiba's cheek. Heh, don't worry about me. Kiba grinned in response to this, and together, the two slowly but surely made their way over to the park.

Breathing a sigh of relief as they finally reached the park, the two made a beeline for the nearest tree, doing their best to ignore the confused stares of the other park-goers. A couple of very young children pointed and chattered at them, but they were quickly shushed by their parents.

Kiba blushed. "Ah, man, you'd think I'd get used to that after all this time..."

Akamaru, though he was blushing as well, shook it off. Eh, don't worry about it, Kiba; nothing we can do about it, anyway. Kiba, though he was still blushing, managed a smile.

Eventually, the two made it to the tree. Wagging his tail, Akamaru flopped down, coming to rest his side against the tree. Sighing in relief, Kiba let himself fall against Akamaru, coming to rest against the dog's belly and draping his arms along his buddy, as though he were relaxing on a bench. "Aaahhh....now this is more like it," the young dog-nin sighed, closing his eyes. "Now we can just kick back, relax, and..." His sentence ground to a stop as his cheeks puffed up, and he let out a loud, sudden burp...

RRRRRRRRRRIIIIIIIIP!

...that, it turned out, was the last straw for his overtaxed zipper. Already straining, the thin piece of metal burst off, ripping right down the middle of his pants in the process. Kiba and Akamaru's eyes both widened at the noise, and they looked down, the former blushing wildly, realizing that some of his paw-print patterned boxers were now showing for the whole world to see, and even more would likely be showing by the time his gut digested everything...

"Aw, damn it," Kiba muttered, his voice very small. "Mom's gonna kill me..." Not sure of what he could say, Akamaru merely whined and licked Kiba's cheek once again. Acknowledging this action with a grateful smirk, Kiba settled back against Akamaru, sighing and closing his eyes. Ah, well, it's like Akamaru said: nothing I can do about it... Closing his eyes, he took a deep breath through his nostrils, taking note of the myriad scents that wafted to his sensitive nose as he did so. Well, he thought as he let a smile creep across his face, feeling the sunlight warm his face even beneath the tree, At least it's a nice day out...

A few minutes passed, before...
1153311222122221221122121211.title: Resting it Off

choices: Kiba's tummy had shrunken just enough to make him mobile again.
It's been so long that Kiba's tummy had shrunken a considerable amount.
11533112221222212211221212112.content:
Some time had ticked away. Before either the boy or dog knew it, both had drifted into a deep, peaceful slumber beneath the large tree shading them from the sunlight shining down over the rest of the park. A content smile grew over Kiba's face as he nuzzled comfortably against the dog's still rather bloated tummy. Akamaru didn't seem to mind at all. In fact, a weary dog smile crept over his face as well as the two continued to sleep off their massive meals. With a perfect mix of shade, daylight warmth, and the heavy feeling of sleeping off their bulbous tummies, the two probably could have stayed in this spot and position for hours if only left in peace.

(If only...)

"Oi, dog-breath!"

Grimacing a bit, Kiba's eyes slowly fluttered open, only to be greeted by the sight of an all-too-familiar face grinning back at him. Rubbing his eyes, Kiba groaned as he sat up, best he could. "Rgh, hello to you too, bonehead..."

Said bonehead; Naruto Uzumaki, also in the same physical state as his dog-nin pal, held his hands behind his back and rocked back and forth idly as he glanced down at Kiba and Akamaru. "Whatcha doing all the way up here?" the young ninja asked. Kiba smirked and said, "What's it look like? Trying to rest this off!" The boy patted his bloated tummy for emphasis, causing it to wobble slightly. Naruto's eyes widened with only faint surprise at the sight; far too used to seeing his friend...and himself in such a immobilized state post feasting. "Wow, guess ya musta been pretty damn hungry," Naruto said, poking Kiba's belly and causing Kiba to grunt in annoyance as he swatted Naruto's hand away then smirked to himself shortly after. "Well, I was actually kinda curious to see much I could put away on my own, without any kinda competitive edge attached."

"Not half bad," Naruto said, relatively impressed with Kiba's eating ability, before grinning smugly and adding, "though I could still probably top that in my sleep if I really wanted to." Kiba scoffed and rolled his eyes. "Uhhh-huh, whatever you say, Naruto, whateeever you say..."

"Still, it's too bad I was busy training. I was feelin' energetic and all that jumping around worked up a hell of an appetite," Naruto said, rubbing his stomach hungrily, to which Kiba shrugged and said, "Eh, next time. Preferably when I'm not on the verge of bursting..."

Naruto snickered, earning a curiously glance from the dog-nin. "Hehe, ohhhh, I think you're well past the verge of bursting, Mr. Paw-Print-Undie-Wondies..." Kiba's face immediately flushed red with a fuming mixture of embarrassment and fury as Naruto pointed towards Kiba's exposed boxers and proceeded to laugh even harder. "S-shut up, dumbass!" Kiba exclaimed angrily as he grumbled to himself and folded his arms angrily. Naruto continued to snicker as Kiba glanced a bit more angrily and shouted, "I mean it! It's bad enough I gotta try and rest this gut off with all the damn world able to see these things; which'll be even worse once my stomach ain't obstructing view, and even worse that my mom's gonna raise Hell when she sees I busted another pair of pant! I don't need any more lip, got it?"

Easing back a bit, Naruto nonetheless smiled a bit more playfully. "Easy, dog-boy, I'm just foolin' with'cha," he said, playfully nudging Kiba in the shoulder, eventually causing him to ease up a bit as he said, "Ah, whatever. Not much I can do about it, so I guess there's no use making a fuss, right?"

To which, Naruto raised an eyebrow and said, "Well, who says there's nothing you can do about it?" Kiba glanced curiously at the young blond as he continued. "It ain't like there's no tailors or clothing shops out there who don't make the same kinda pants, right? You got money, don'tcha? Why not just buy another pair and pretend it's the same? It ain't like your mom'll notice the difference, right?" Kiba waved his hand a bit dismissively and said, "Nah, she's more keen than that. She'll know if something's new or worn out." Hearing that, Naruto grinned a bit mischievously and said, "Then why not break 'em in first? Y'know, like by getting your ass kicked yet again by yours truly? Besides, looks like you can use the workout," Naruto added, pointing at Kiba's bloated gut for emphasis. That actually hadn't sounded like such a bad idea...and the idea of making Naruto eat his words, and dirt after kicking HIS ass didn't sound half bad either.

"Y'know something, bonehead? That might've been one of the smartest suggestions I've heard you make in a long time...only I'm still way too full and way too tired to be moving around just yet," Kiba said, to which Naruto smiled and said, "You might be a bloated slug right now, but I've still got TONS of energy! Tell ya what, lend me however much those pants cost, and I'll go pick'em up for ya!"

"You'd do that?" Kiba asked, to which Naruto nodded and said, "Hey, why not? Sooner you're not showcasing those stupid boxers to all of Konoha, the sooner we can play around and all that!" Kiba scowled at Naruto's remark, but eventually, his expression worked its way back to an appreciative smile. "Thanks, man," he said as he reached into his back pocket and spotted Naruto some cash.

Naruto immediately took off, while Kiba leaned back against Akamaru, who was still in a very deep sleep. Smiling at the sight, Kiba stretched his arms up and yawned heartily before dropping them down and once again drifting off into a slumber alongside his canine companion.

Quite a while had passed, as Naruto gunned through various different stores, looking for the same size and style pants as what Kiba was wearing, before eventually finding a pair and making his way back to the park where the boy and large dog were still resting off their ample meals.

By the time Naruto reached the two...
11533112221222212211221212112.title: A certain idiot approaches him...

choices: The three collapse, exhausted but happy
115331122212222122112212121122.content:
Naruto, pants in hand, tilted his head curiously. "Huh, musta been gone longer than I thought..."

Indeed, while he had been gone, Kiba and Akamaru's metabolisms had appeared to kick in, the massive amount of food in their midsections beginning to digest at an impressive rate. Kiba's, in particular, had shrunken a great deal, and no longer appeared quite so massively bloated, though his hoodie still rested just above his belly-button (which, Naruto noted, had reverted to its natural innie state.) Eyes moving downward, he snickered as he saw Kiba's paw-print boxers showing through his ruined pants even moreso than before, now that his belly wasn't obstructing them. Damn, Kiba really did a number on those pants, Naruto thought through his giggles. Just how much did he eat? Then, of course, he remembered just how big Kiba's tummy had been when he'd come across the pair; a gut that size, it was no wonder his pants had finally given up the ghost. It was a good thing their current states sped up their already-active metabolisms...

Gotta say, that was pretty impressive that he ate that much, Naruto mused, getting himself under control. Still, it's not like I couldn't eat him under the table, even if its by myself...

He definitely planned to do so later, but for now, just as he'd told Kiba, he was practically bursting with energy, and he was itching to expend it. "Alright, Kiba," Naruto muttered, smirking as he drew something from his pocket. It was a loose feather, a long, whispy thing he'd found while on his way back to the park, and which he'd picked up when a burst of inspiration hit him. "Time to wake up..." Grinning wickedly, he took the stem of the feather in his hand and extended it, not stopping until the tip was inside Kiba's navel. The young dog-nin jerked a bit, his face twitching, but otherwise continued to slumber. Naruto snickered. Perfect. He proceeded to wiggle the feather around in the pit, which, predictably, caused Kiba to continue twitching, even as the sides of his mouth lifted up. Faster and faster he went, and the wider and wider Kiba's smile became, and a few giggles even began to come forth from his lips, until...

"BAHAHAHAHA!" The little dog nin broke into uproarious laughter, sitting up and wrapping his arms around his still somewhat-bloated tummy, just missing the feather as Naruto pulled it back. "Stoppit, I'm tickl---" His eyes opened, and his smile promptly faded as he laid eyes on
the grinning blonde. "Naruto? What---" His eyes widened as he noticed the feather in the other boy's hand. "What...don't tell me you..." Naruto's only response was a wide, toothy grin and a giggle. "...you did," Kiba deadpanned, folding his arms. "Why am I not surprised?"

"Ah, c'mon, Kiba," Naruto answered, discarding the feather. "You hafta admit, it was funny..."

Still scowling, Kiba got to his feet, tugging his hoodie down as far as it would go with one hand, which, it turned out, was right under his navel, the other holding up his busted pants. "OK, maybe a little, but next time just shake me."

Naruto stuck his tongue out. "Awww, you're no fun..." Suddenly, he remembered what he'd woken Kiba up for in the first place. "Oh, by the way..." Grinning, he thrust the pants he'd gotten for Kiba-identical to the ripped ones he was wearing-forward. "I got these for ya."

In spite of his annoyance, Kiba smiled a bit as he took the pants, a little touched. "...thanks, Naruto."

In response, the blonde, smirked and punched Kiba lightly in the shoulder. "Hey, what are friends for, right?"

Kiba laughed a little bit. "Huh, ya know, Akamaru said the same thing to me earlier..."

At his name being mentioned, the dog blinked opened his eyes, yawning widely. Did someone call my name...? the dog chuffed blearily, climbing to his paws. Hearing Akamaru wake up, Kiba turned around, grinning as he threw his arms around Akamaru's neck. "Hey, Akamaru! Ya sleep good?"

Smacking his chops, the dog wagged his tail, licking the side of Kiba's face. Like a pup. What about you, little buddy?

"Like a little kid," Kiba replied, giggling a bit. At this, Akamaru wagged his tail some more, and was about to reply when he caught a glimpse of something behind Kiba. Refocusing his view, Akamaru's eyes widened as he saw Naruto, though his tail never stopped wagging. Naruto? the dog barked, surprised. Sensing what his buddy wanted to do, Kiba let go of the dog's neck and went behind the tree with his pants to change. Giving an appreciate glance at his retreating pal, Akamaru trotted towards Naruto, tongue lolling. Naruto, catching notice of this, began to greet the dog, but was caught off guard by Akamaru licking his face. "WAGH! Good to see you too, Akamaru," Naruto giggled, wiping his face with a sleeve before ruffling the dog's big white head. The dog barked happily in response.

Within a minute or so, Kiba emerged from behind the tree, now clad in the new pair of pants that Naruto had gotten for him; they were zipped up, but considering his stomach was still somewhat swollen, he'd elected to leave them unbuttoned, at least until his gut digested some more. At the sight of Akamaru licking Naruto's face, Kiba smirked at the boy. "Whatcha doin', Uzumaki? Tryin' ta steal my pal?"

Naruto smirked back. "Nah, Akamaru was just sayin' hi; you can have him back, now." Woofing, and licking Naruto's face one last time, Akamaru trotted back to his dog-nin buddy. His eyes widened. Hey, what happened to your pants? They're as good as new!

Kiba laughed, petting the dog happily. "That's 'cause they ARE new." He threw an appreciative look over at Naruto. "Thank the bonehead, here; I spotted him some cash, and he got 'em for me." At this, the blonde giggled and folded his arms behind his head.

Really? Akamaru woofed, looking back at Naruto. That was real nice of him. He turned back to his little buddy. When did he get here, anyway?

Kiba laughed, walking around Akamaru to face his blonde friend. "I'll tell ya later, boy..." His eyes gleamed, and he smirked. "...just as soon as I kick this moron's ass!" Dropping to all fours, Kiba began rushing at Naruto.

Laughing uproariously, Naruto hopped backwards; regressed or no, they were still ninja, and had the jumping abilities to prove it. "I'd like to see you try, dog-breath!" Upon landing, Naruto turned and raced off through the park.

Kiba grinned. "Oh, no way in hell you're gettin' away that easy, Naruto!" Getting back to his feet, he raced off after Naruto. Akamaru, woofing happily, followed behind him. Soon, the laughter of two young boys and the happy barking of a dog filled the park as the three ran about, chased each other, and play-fought, having a blast as they did so.

Eventually...
115331122212222122112212121122.title: A Ticklish Wakeup Call

choices: "Y'know, there's a new buffet in town..."
1153311222122221221122121211221.content:
"Hahaha! C'mon, dog-breath! That the best ya can do?" called out Naruto cockily as he avoided a flurry of sparring blows from an equally cocky grinning Kiba, before Naruto jumped back, creating some distance between the two; enough for him to stick his tongue out playfully at the young dog-nin. "See? Told'ja I had tons of energy to spare today. All that eating suck your energy away, smartass?" remarked Naruto, folding his arms with a grin across his face, more than ready and awaiting for Kiba to make the next move.

Instead, Kiba grinned mischievously at Naruto's remarked and feigned defeat as he kicked the grass beneath him. "Ah shucks! You're just too fast for me today, Uzumaki! I guess I outta just admit defeat while I-now, Akamaru!!" A flash of the last time the two had decided to play in the park played in Naruto mind, and immediately, the boy recalled when the big dog got involved and decided to topple over him, damn near crushing him on the spot! Immediately, Naruto turned and stepped back, expecting Akamaru to flank his side. But to his surprise, there was nothing to his side. However, as soon as he took his eyes off of Kiba, a sudden rustling caught his ear, and immediately he turned back to where the boy was standing, eyes now wider than saucers.

BAM!

Immediately, Kiba lept from all fours and pounced at Naruto, causing the two boys to topple and roll on the grass while Akamaru continued to bark happily and follow not too far behind. The two continued to roll down, sparring each other the entire way as they rolled down a slight incline before landing back down to the level plain with Kiba on top, pinning down Naruto in what he perceived to be victory. Catching their breath, the two youths laughed heartily as Naruto struggled and noted, "Heh, good one, dog-boy! But lets see you top THIS!" With all the excitement of their play-fight, Kiba had forgotten all about Naruto's newfound secret weapon; the feather!

Wasting no time, the boy fluttered it at a portion of Kiba's skin now exposed from his hoodie being ruffled up from their roughhousing. Immediately, the boy lost his grip just enough for Naruto to break free as Kiba laughed ticklishly, still trying to swat the feather away. "HeehahahaHEY! No FAAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!" was all Kiba could mutter in his current state, when suddenly Akamaru capitalized and seized the feather from Naruto unexpectedly with his mouth and trotted away. Before Naruto could try and take it back, Kiba immediately lounged back at the boy, pinning him down yet again. "Ha! Gotta resort to cheating, eh? Well, two can play that game!" Kiba then turned to his canine companion and held out his hand. "Akamaru?"

The dog barked happily as he trotted over to Kiba and placed the feather from his mouth to Kiba's hand. Naruto's eyes widened. "Oh crap..." was all he could get out as Kiba started flickering the boy in the face with it, causing to laugh uncontrollably while trying to escape. Eventually, he managed to break Kiba's grip and tackle him from the ground, until he ended up on top, only for Kiba to retaliate in kind.

Back and forth, back and forth, the two were a pair of evenly matched young ninjas, each one landing one move while the other retaliated in kind, until both boys gave in and dropped onto their backs. Panting heavily. As they did, Akamaru loomed over the two and grinned mischievously to himself before leaning down towards the boys. Knowing full well what was coming, however exhausted; the two rolled away just in time before Akamaru could come crashing down atop them, leaving all three on the ground, breathing heavily. A few more moments of this passed, before the two young ninjas erupted into exhausted but hearty laughter.

"Hahahaha! Ohhh man, that was a blast!" said Naruto, as he wiped some sweat from his brow with his sleeve. Kiba rested his hands atop his stomach and sighed heartily as he said, "Ahhh, JUST what I needed!" he said, feeling his stomach having shrunken an ample amount. To the point where his hoodie concealed it completely, and there was only a barely noticeable bump beneath hoodie. He looked back at Akamaru; whose tummy had also shrunken a great amount from all his running and jumping around to keep up with the boys, an smiled, scratching the dog's tummy wearily, causing the dog to stick his tongue to the side of his mouth and kick his hind leg happily. Naruto and Kiba couldn't help but giggle at the scene. "Man, we outta do that more often as long as we're like this!" Naruto exclaimed. "That was more fun than anything in training!"

Kiba nodded in agreement and was about to reply, when suddenly a loud rumbling filled the air. He looked around curiously to find the source, only to see Naruto blushing as he rested his arms atop his roaring tummy. "Heh, guess whoopin' ass works up an appetite," Naruto said, chuckling sheepishly as he rubbed the back of his head. Kiba raised an eyebrow and was about to reply yet again, when an even louder roaring emanating from his own stomach shut him down, earning an equally sheepish chuckle of embarrassment from the boy.

"Heh, guess 'next time' is coming sooner than we thought, eh Bone-head?" Kiba noted, rubbing his hungry tummy eagerly. Hearing that, Akamaru's ears drooped to his sides. But before he could protest, sure enough, his own slimmer tummy began to rumble hungrily as well. Flushing beneath his fur, he sighed to himself, all but conceding against any notion of trying to make sure the two youths wouldn't end up overdoing it. It was gonna happen, and Akamaru knew that, and he knew he'd likely end up going overboard himself. So, rather than protest, he gave up and turned to his dog-nin friend and licked his face both playfully and to get his attention. Sooo.....what do you feel like eating, Kiba?

Wiping his face and giggling to himself, Kiba thought for a moment before he turned to Naruto, still catching his breath, and asked, "Oi, ramen-for-brains, whadduya feel like eatin'?"

Tilting his head for a moment, Naruto thought, before grinning impishly and turning back to Kiba and Akamaru...
1153311222122221221122121211221.title: The three collapse, exhausted but happy.

choices: The two catch up to Naruto, and together they reach Ichiraku's
By the time the two reach Ichiraku's, Naruto has already ordered his first bowl
11533112221222212211221212112212.content:
Naruto grinned as he replied to Kiba's question, rooting around in his pants (dark blue shorts that stopped an inch or so beneath his knees) pocket and pulling out two slips of paper, holding them up for the dog-nin to see. Kiba's eyes widened. "Are those what I think they are...?"

"Uh-huh!" Naruto beamed, nodding eagerly. "Two all-you-eat coupons to Ichiraku's!" Akamaru whined, rolling his eyes skyward. He just knew how this was going to end....

Grinning in return, Kiba took one of the slips of paper and examined it. "Damn, all the ramen you can eat for one visit?" Kiba read off the slip of paper. He turned his head toward Naruto, raising an eyebrow as he tucked it away into his pocket. "How didja get your hands on these, anyway?"

Naruto giggled, pocketing the slip he was still holding. "The old man gave them to me when we first got stuck like this, to sorta make things a little easier." His smile faded a bit. "'Course, I wasn't really in the right sort of mood to take advantage of it, so I just stashed it away at my place."

Kiba winced a bit, recalling just how hard the initial days following their transformation had been. "I don't blame ya..." Something suddenly occurred to him. "Wait a minute, we got used to being stuck like this just a couple weeks after it happened. Why didn't ya use it then?"

Naruto laughed nervously, rubbing the back of his head. "Uh, I guess, cause, um..."

"You lost it, didn't you." Kiba's deadpan statement was not a question.

"H-hey!" Naruto protested, jumping to his feet and pointing at Kiba. "I couldn't help it! It was small, and there was a lot of stuff in my room..."

"'Cause you haven't cleaned it in, like, a month or so?" Kiba raised an eyebrow, folding his arms in the process. Akamaru thought about jumping in and pointing out that Kiba's own room was hardly the picture of neatness (as his mother had scolded him and his sister had calmly, but exasperatedly, brought to his attention), but he held his tongue; as much as he hated to admit it, it was always a bit amusing to watch these two go at it...

"S-so what?!" Naruto spat back. "I found it eventually, so what's the big deal?"

Kiba smirked, pushing off his hands and climbing to his feet. "Ah, come off it, Uzumaki; you should know by now I like to rib ya." At this, Naruto folded his arms and looked away, pouting and grumbling to himself. "Hey, c'mon," Kiba prompted, throwing a friendly arm around Naruto's shoulders. "Don't look so grumpy; you're about to stuff your face with your favorite ramen in the world, aren'tcha?" He smirked, this time a bit more friendly. "Lighten up."

Naruto looked back at Kiba's teasingly friendly expression, his face still in a pout. "I-I guess..."

Kiba grinned, seeing that Naruto was starting to come around. "Besides, didn't you say before they were getting new bowls in that are as big as the ones we had at that one restaurant? Ya know, the one where we ordered the entire dessert menu?"

Naruto, unable to resist, cracked a smile. "Y-yeah; they should be in by now..."

Snickering privately, Kiba went in for the finishing blow. "Now, imagine ordering twenty, nah, thirty, heck, FORTY of those monsters and filling your gut to bursting..." Kiba smirked. "Sounds fun, don't it?"

Naruto, now grinning like a dope, said nothing for a moment. Then...

"What the heck are we waiting around here for?" Naruto ducked out from under Kiba's arms and began rushing away. "We've got Ichiraku's to eat!"

Kiba and Akamaru watched him go, the former smirking victoriously and the latter looking at Kiba with an expression containing something not unlike pride. Wow, nice one, Kiba.

Kiba shrugged. "Eh, I just know how the dummy works." He moved in close to Akamaru; getting the cue, the big dog lowered himself, and the young dog-nin hopped onto Akamaru's back. Woofing, Akamaru rose back to his feet. Ya ready, little buddy?

Kiba grinned, a determined look coming across his features. "Always ready, pal; always ready!"

That was all Akamaru needed to hear; tensing his legs, he took off in the direction Naruto had run. As they picked up speed and the wind blew threw their hair/fur, Kiba grinned, pumped a fist in the air, and gave a joyful shout:

"YAHOO!"
11533112221222212211221212112212.title: "Funny you should mention ramen..."

choices: "So I heard those new giant bowls finally came in..."
"We'll take twenty bowls of ramen each to start us off."
115331122212222122112212121122121.content:
Naruto was sprinting on all cylinders full force towards his favorite ramen shack in all the land, more than eagerly anticipating stuffing his craw with as much of those irresistible zesty, steamy noodles and broth as he possibly could. All the world was a blur in his frenzied full-throttle charge towards the stand. Until he heard a four pronged prancing not too distantly, accompanied by, "Move it or lose it, Uzumaki!" Turning, he saw Kiba riding Akamaru like a big white horse jetting from the distance and catching up to him in no time. Not one to be showed up by anyone; least of all Kiba and a big dog, the young ninja grinned confidently and pushed himself onward as he ran as fast as his currently regressed little legs would take him. Seeing that, Kiba grinned back and leaned towards Akamaru's ear and said, "You know what to do, boy!"

Woofing in acknowledgement, Akamaru pranced faster as the two raced as fast as they could, until both the trio noticed how dangerously close they were getting to the stand. "Oh..." was all Kiba could mutter, anticipating yet another devastating wipeout. To his surprise however, both Akamaru and Naruto noticed in time and skidded towards the end, as they decreased their rapidly accelerated speeds and came to an eventual stop. Both Akamaru and Naruto panted heavily as Kiba leaped down from his big pals neck and ruffled his head in a congratulatory manner. "Hehe, man, nice job there, boy!" exclaimed Kiba while Naruto, grinning and still panting for dear life, said, "Heh...yeah...*pants*....nice job...*whew*...getting second place!"

Hearing that, Kiba immediately snapped towards Naruto and raised an eyebrow as he exclaimed, "Are you blind, dummy? Akamaru and I just trail-blazed past you!" Naruto scowled, amidst catching his breath and said, "First...*pants*...of all, you didn't trail-blaze past anyone....*phew*....Akamaru did! Second of all, Akamaru ALMOST trail-blazed, before I went into maximum overdrive and made you both eat my dust!"

The two got in each others faces and began their infamous back and forth arguing while Akamaru watched and rolled his eyes with a smirk. I wish I could contribute this to their regression...I really do... He continued watching and smirked to himself. Buuuuut at least it's funnier watching them do their back and forth as kids. He then looked up and remembered where they were, and immediately composed himself as he barked towards Kiba to get is attention while he was still having another obscure shouting match with Naruto. Ummm, Kiba?

Kiba looked up, and immediately, his scale retained a more nervous expression. "Oh, crap." Catching Kiba retain his composure, Naruto turned curiously and immediately did the same as he saw Teuchi dumbfound as he watched the two go on and on. "Oi, old timer! Heh...ehhhh h-how's it going?" Naruto asked, as a sheepish smile grew over his face. Teuchi scratched the top of his head and added, "I was just about to ask the two of you the same thing."

Adjusting himself in a more composed manner, Teuchi smirked and shook his head as he asked, "So, what'll it, boys? The usual?"

Naruto then turned to Kiba and grinned impishly as he turned back to Teuchi and replied...
115331122212222122112212121122121.title: They catch up to Naruto, and all reach Ichiraku's.

choices: One of their friends, passing by, notices them
Teuchi comes out with their first bowls
1153311222122221221122121211221211.content:
Naruto giggled as he said this, grinning up at Teuchi. "Ya think ya can hook us up with summa those?"

Teuchi blinked, his eyes widening a bit (even if he wasn't actually that surprised at the request.) "Uh...you kids sure? I mean, they're pretty big; each bowl holds at least four, five regular sized bowls worth of ramen..."

Kiba smirked, hopping up on a stool as Naruto did the same. "Eh, we've had bowls about that size before...and that was before we plowed through the place's entire dessert menu." Akamaru whined, remembering exactly how engorged the three of them had gotten after that whole ordeal, even if it had been really fun.

Teuchi shook his head, though he was unable to repress a small smile; some things never changed. "Alright then, boys," he spoke up. "Two of Ichiraku's Jumbo Bowls..."

"Three!" Kiba corrected, grinning at Akamaru. "Akamaru's gonna be having some, too!"

Akamaru gaped at Kiba, whining. I REALLY wish you'd stop dragging me into these things...

Teuchi recoiled for a moment, but managed to recompose himself; at this point, Kiba had been coming to Ichiraku's often enough to know he seldom left Akamaru out when it came to ramen. "Alright, then, THREE of Ichiraku's Jumbo Bowls." He chuckled a bit. "What kind you kids want?"

Naruto grinned. "I'll take a miso ramen, lotsa char siu!"

Kiba smirked. "I'll take the a miso ramen, too, 'cept with a lotta meat!!" He flicked his eyes toward his ninken buddy. "What about you, Akamaru?"

Akamaru sighed. Might as well... he muttered. I'll just do the same, thanks.

Grinning, Kiba repeated this to Teuchi, who nodded. "Alright: three jumbo bowls, one miso with extra char siu, two miso with extra meat." He turned around, walking back toward the back."They'll take a little longer, but I'll have 'em out as soon as I can!" With that, he headed into the back to prepare their dishes.

Licking his lips, Naruto turned towards Kiba. "Oh man, this is gonna be awesome!" He grinned. "How many ya think we'll be able to manage?"

Kiba smirked in response. "I dunno...but he said there were four or five bowls worth in each jumbo bowl." He grinned. "I'm gonna try for five, six..."

Naruto snorted. "Six? That's nothing! I'm gonna try going for ten!"

Kiba snickered. "Twelve!"

"Fourteen!" Naruto retorted.

"Sixteen!"

"Eighteen!"

As the boys continued goading each other, Akamaru whined, even as he laid down on the ground. Oh, great...Kiba's gonna end up busting his pants all over again...

As the boys continued playfully bickering with each other...
1153311222122221221122121211221211.title: "So I heard those new giant bowls finally c...

choices: Teuchi arrives with their first bowls.
11533112221222212211221212112212111.content:
The two youths continued their back and forth banter, with both boys continuing to proudly exclaim how many bowls they planned on consuming (which was somewhere around seventy nine at this point...) when suddenly, they heard a familiar sounding sigh, followed by an even more familiar, "...you troublesome guys never change..."

Immediately, both the boys and Akamaru alike turned to see Shikamaru standing not too far away with his hands in his pockets. Naruto smiled and immediately hopped down from his stool to greet his friend. "Oh, hi, Shikamaru! Long time!" Shikamaru smirked and said, "Eh, not that long," he then looked past Naruto towards Kiba, who smiled a bit nervously, hoping his friend wouldn't notice his tummy still just slightly distended from his previous feasting. "Hey to you too." Shikamaru said with a faint smirk. Kiba laughed, still uneasily, but nonetheless, hopped down from his seat to properly greet his ninja friend.

"Oi, where's Choji at?" asked Kiba, noticing the absence of Shikamaru's best friend, to which Shikamaru shrugged lazily and shook his head, "He's off stuffing his face somewhere. Me? I didn't really feel like eating, so I just went for a little walk and what have you." Akamaru smirked to himself. A walk, eh? I always figured something like that was way too much work for a lazy bum...

Shikamaru tilted his head upward at the shack then back down at the two youths. "Ichiraku's, eh I take it to mean you guys're doing a little better then?" he said, earning a curious glance from Naruto. "Err, well yeah, but how do ya figure?" Shikamaru sighed and said, "Cause the only time I ever see you two eat together is when you're both stuffing your faces beyond reason," he then shrugged and added, "...and you tend not to do that unless you're chipper." Despite themselves, the two laughed sheepishly as Kiba said, "Guess ya got us there."

"That figures," Shikamaru murmured under his breath. He then turned to Akamaru and added, "Well, least you're here to help these guys get around after they overdo it...yet again..." Akamaru's face flushed red beneath his fur as he chuckled sheepishly. Kiba just grinned happily and added, "Actually, Akamaru's gonna be diggin' in with us!"

Ehhh hehe...what can I say...? If you can't beat 'em...join 'em, right...? Akamaru mused, a mixture of embarrassment and submission to the futility of trying to protest the inevitable stuffing fest to be.

Naruto then grinned a bit mischievously as he turned his attention to Shikamaru and said, "Well, if you're soooo worried about how we're gonna get around when we're done with the many many jumbo bowls we're gonna put away...you COULD stick around and keep an eye on us."

Catching this, Kiba grinned himself and shrugged innocently as he added, "Yeah, you said it yourself, it's not like you have anything ELSE going on right about now, right?" Akamaru was unable to suppress some snickering as he saw Shikamaru rub his temples in annoyance.

...Ugh, this is gonna be a drag... Shikamaru thought to himself, as he turned to the boys and; after mumbling some more annoyances, finally said, "...It'd be irresponsible of me to just leave you guys on your own in this state...and after you're all immobilized...so fine, I'll...keep an eye on you guys...for now at least..."

Akamaru couldn't help but sigh with some relief, knowing he wouldn't bare the burden of helping the boys get by all on his own. Even if this was just a temporary thing...

...aaaand even if the person assisting them was the laziest ninja to ever grace Konoha...

As the three continued to chat and catch up...
11533112221222212211221212112212111.title: One of their friends, passing by, notices them

1153311222122222.content: Some time after the events of the Termina trip, Kiba wakes up to find himself in a mysterious, heavily-forested area, with Akamaru by his side....?
1153311222122222.title: How about this...

choices: A set of very familiar childrens' clothing
A large steak meal with all the fixings
11533112221222221.content:
Kiba yawned mightily, stretching his arms skyward and sitting up. He grinned groggily as he felt the familiar weight of Akamaru against his back. "Mmmm...mornin', Akamaru," he mumbled, eyes still closed. Lowering his arms, he smiled and smacked his chops.

Akamaru shifted a bit, lifting his massive head and letting out a great yawn of his own. <i>Mornin', Kiba...</i> the dog woofed groggily, smacking his own chops. Smiling at the sound of his pal's voice, Kiba rested back against the dog, resting his palms on his bed.

The smile quickly became a frown as he felt some more. His bed felt...odd. Rather than a flat, somewhat soft surface, he felt multiple soft, firm points pressing against his palms. It almost felt like...

Eyes shooting open, he looked down and noticed that, yes, he and Akamaru were sitting on the ground and fairly tall grasses. "Wh-what the hell..."

Upon feeling a pleasant breeze against his face, he looked up...and gaped.

Having only half-registered Kiba's shock and sudden silence, Akamaru lifted his head up further, blearily blinking his eyes open. <i>Kiba, what're you...</i> As soon as he laid eyes on his surroundings, however, all his tiredness fell away, and his expression mirrored that of his partner.

Rather than Kiba's bedroom, where they had fallen fast asleep after getting back from a strenuous mission-Kiba changing from his usual black jumpsuit and net shirt to a pair of old pants and an equally battered red shirt with several slash marks across them-, they now found themselves in the middle of what appeared to be a thick, lush forest. Trees reached high into the sky, their tops bursting with foliage, lush grass surrounded them, and flowers poked out of the ground at intermittent points.

Kiba was the first to break the silence. "Where...where the hell are we...?" Cautiously, he got to his feet, further examining his surroundings. Following suit, Akamaru got to his own paws, joining his partner in ogling his surroundings. <i>Is...is this a dream...?</i>

"Realest damn dream I've ever had," Kiba murmured, not taking his eyes from his surroundings. As he continued staring, he brought his hand up to his mouth and bit down with his sharp, Inuzuka teeth. "Ow!" He exclaimed, jerking his hand back.

Akamaru whimpered, glancing at Kiba. <i>Yyyyeah, I'm gonna go out on a limb and say this ISN'T a dream. A Genjutsu maybe, but...</i>

Kiba nodded slightly, but something told him that this was no illusion...

"I'm checking this place out," he murmured, heading off into the trees.

This snapped the dog out of his reverie. <i>W-wait a sec, Kiba!</i> he barked, hurrying after him. <i>We don't even know where we are! There could be literally ANYTHING waiting out there!</i>

As he walked quickly, Kiba grinned at Akamaru. "Hey, nothing I can't handle with my best buddy at my side," he replied.

In spite of himself, Akamaru couldn't help but wag his tail. <i>Maybe, but like I said, we don't know if this is a Genjutsu or something; don't just go charging off.</i>

Kiba mock-sighed. "Alright, fine..." He winked at the dog. "If I decide to go charging off, I'll let you know, so you can be right beside me."

Akamaru whined a bit, though he couldn't help but wag his tail again; though Kiba's tone was jovial, it was also 100% serious. Of course it was; they were best buddies, after all...

They continued wandering through the forest, marveling at the sights, and at just how...<i>vibrant</i> everything looked. In spite of this, they both remained vigilant; for all they knew, this could be some elaborate trap...

As such, they continued walking, alternatively taking in the sights and remaining on guard, until, finally, they emerged from the trees into a large, spacious clearing. The clearing was surrounded on all sides by more trees-an open space in the middle of an ocean of forest. That wasn't what caught their attention, though; what caught their attention was what was IN the clearing. Specifically, it was...
11533112221222221.title: Strange Surroundings

choices: Kiba continues tearing into his steak without incident.
Akamaru hears a rustling in the woods...
115331122212222212.content:
Rather, what caught the young dog-nin's attention was a decently sized table and one singular seat. And atop that table? A MASSIVE slab of tenderloin steak, lathered in rich sauce, crumbled, caramelized onions, black crushed peppers, and accompanied by a huge slab of gravy soaked mashed potatoes, with those same caramelized onions crumbled on top with cheese melting right into the suds. The steaming plate was accompanied by a large pitcher of cola, and a side loaf of freshly baked garlic bread. Kiba and Akamaru could do little more than gape at the beyond appetizing sight before them.

"...Okay, something is DEFINITELY up here..." murmured Kiba as he cautiously approached the table with an equally cautious Akamaru. The dog-nin and nin-dog both occasionally glanced back up at the trees, trying to check in case there were enemy ninjas waiting to pounce on what looked like a highly elaborate...yet kind of obvious trap...if it was one.

What are you doing, Kiba? asked Akamaru as the teen approached the steak.

As if to answer, Kiba sniffed sternly at the dish, the bread, and the beverage. Due to his keen sense of smell, he of all people would be able to detect any irregularities, were substances implemented in anything set before them now. This continued for a few moments more, Kiba sniffing and Akamaru waiting to see what the verdict was. To Akamaru's surprise, Kiba's stern expression eased into one of even more confusion.

What? What's wrong?

"That's just it, boy, nothing...there's nothing odd about the steak, the bread or the drink at all..." answered the teen. And much to his and Akamaru's surprise, his mouth watered slightly at the sheer tenderness of the spread. Shaking that off, the two looked around some more.

Well, obviously, someone's messing with us, because you don't just find this kind of stuff lying out in the open forest like this...

"...Yeah, could be a distraction or something. Wait til I start eating and gettin' REALLY into it, then jump me...well, sorry to disappoint whoever's out there, but I ain't no bonehead, so whatever they're plannin' ain't gonna-"

But before Kiba could finish, an especially LOUD rumble emitted from the young mans' abdomen. Face reddening notably, Kiba's eyes widened as he glanced down at his stomach and rested a palm against it as it rumbled HUNGRILY again. Some moments passed before the teen slowly turned his gaze towards the table behind him. And almost immediately, Akamaru's ears drooped down.

Kiba, you aren't SERIOUSLY thinking what you're thinking, are you...?

At this, Kiba rubbed the back of his head and said, "W-well, I know it ain't POISONOUS, and, well...it DOES look really freakin' good..."

Someone cooked a fresh, and MASSIVE steak and just left it out in the middle of nowhere. You don't think that's...a LITTLE weird...?

"Oh come on, of COURSE it is! But, I mean, no use lettin' it all go to waste, right? 'Sides, ain't like I can't stop to kick the ass of whoever might try to get the jump on me, right"

Maybe so, but-

"-And besides, you know I forgot to eat...last time we were conscious. I ain't gonna be at my best if I'm starvin', right?"

At this, the dog immediately rolled his eyes and shook his head. Before he could protest further, Kiba had pulled the seat out and set himself before the table, still glancing around him, waiting for someone or something to strike. Taking a whiff again, Kiba couldn't help but salivate at the glorious scent of beef, and immediately cut himself a piece, lathered in sauce, peppers and the crumbled onions. Slowly, he brought it to his mouth while Akamaru watched fearfully. Then, after popping it in, the boy chewed slowly and cautiously, then his eyes widened. Akamaru whined with concern.

Oh no, it was poisonous, wasn't-

-And before Akamaru could finish, Kiba immediately cut himself another piece and chomped onto it voraciously, practically beaming at the sheer flavor.

"Holy crap! This tastes...this tastes...HOLY CRAP!" was all Kiba could get out before digging more into his steak. Akamaru just sat there, exoression deadpanned and flat as Kiba continued tearing into his steak with glee.

...Fantastic...

Akamaru stands watch, still glancing around in case this was still an elaborate rouse. Kiba, meanwhile, tears into his steak with swift speed, savoring the raw flavor of beef...
115331122212222212.title: A large steak meal with all the fixings...

choices: Kiba is still eating, and Akamaru and Kuromaru watch until he takes a break
Kiba is taking a break, allowing Akamaru to get his attention.
1153311222122222122.content:
Even as Akamaru kept watch on the surrounding woods, he couldn't help but flick his eyes back to Kiba every now and again. The dog-nin was tearing voraciously into his unexpected meal, alternating bites of meat and mashed potatoes with bites right off the loaf of bread and long swigs of the cola. If the expression on his face was any indication, the tastes were indescribable....

Akamaru sighed, even as he turned his attention back to the woods. Even if he didn't smell anything off, I still don't think it's a good idea for him to be eating like that in a place like this. True, eating WOULD help give him the energy he needed on the off chance this WAS a trap of some sort...but if he became too stuffed, that'd make him an easy target.

He's been spending too much time competing with Naruto, the dog-nin decided, thinking of the blonde ninja. He was a strong shinobi, a worthy rival, and a good friend, but his and Kiba's personalities seemed to feed off one another, and their already competitive natures appeared to be amplified in the meantime....

Akamaru sighed again; he'd have to find some way to break it to Kiba that stuffing himself in a place like this wouldn't exactly be the best---

Akamaru's ears perked as he heard something coming from the woods. What the...? He strained his ears. Nothing for a few moments, but then...

There! A bush, right by the edge of the woods. A small part of it shook a bit, then went still again.

Akamaru growled. I knew it! It WAS a trap! Acting almost entirely on instinct, Akamaru took off toward the disturbance. In response to this, whoever was hiding in the bushes darted out, rushing into the woods. In response, Akamaru gave chase, pursuing the intruder into the woods.

As he ran deeper into the forest and waved around and between the trees, he took note of his target: specifically, that it appeared quadrupedal, like he was, and, though the foliage made it hard to make out details, very, very small.

That didn't mean much, though; for all he knew, it could have been an enemy ninja disguising themselves, or a trained ninja animal like himself....

And so, he continued chasing the small figure, who, he noted, ran with a surprising speed. Still, he thought, with a measure of pride, he was much larger, and, from the glimpses he was able to catch of his quarry, much better-muscled.

Indeed, it wasn't long before the figure apparently stumbled...and at the speed it was going, that was enough to send it tumbling along at a good pace.

Akamaru smirked a doggy smirk, quickening his pace. Gotcha.

The figure continued tumbling, eventually coming to stop against a bush. Grinning, Akamaru dug his paws into the ground, coming to a stop before the figure. Alright, talk! he barked loudly, turning his head down towards the figure. Who the hell are you, and why were you...

A sudden whimpering cut through his demands, and Akamaru, despite himself, snapped his muzzle shut. What the...? That sounded almost like.... Shaking his head, he peered down at his quarry, and this time, REALLY looked at him.

He was a very young pup, about as old as Akamaru had been when he'd first been given to Kiba. He was staring up at Akamaru, whimpering and shivering. Only one of his ears was erect; the other one was flopped over his eye.

Akamaru winced. Ah, geez, it's only a pup, he thought, with no small measure of guilt. Probably just heard Kiba eating and came to watch...wait.

Telling himself that he MUST be seeing things, he took a closer look at the pup. The pup had black fur all over his top, with white fur on the bottom starting from the middle of his muzzle, and yellow eyes...

Very familiar yellow eyes.

Akamaru shook his head. No, it can't be, that's ridiculous... he began telling himself, but then stopped. He and Kiba had fallen asleep in his bed, woken up in this strange (though beautiful) place, found a huge steak meal set out seemingly for Kiba's benefit...ever moment since they had woken up had been sheer ridiculousness. Besides, he was a ninja dog; weirdness and strange situations were kind of his thing.

And so, taking a breath, he asked, Kid? What's your, erm, name?

The pup jolted a bit. "Wh-what?" he asked, somewhat fearfully...and in human language.

Akamaru winced. He was speaking human...

Y-your name, Akamaru managed, What's your name?

The pup gulped. "M-my name...?" He glanced around nervously, before returning his attention to the big dog before him. "Kuromaru...m-my name's Kuromaru..."

Akamaru stared at the pup for a few moments longer, not sure in the slightest what to make of this. The pup spoke human, and he had the same coloring, but...

Kuromaru was stern. Kuromaru was intimidating. Kuromaru could be a hardass, especially when it came to training. But, above all else, Kuromaru was not the cutest little cinnamon roll he had ever seen in his...

Akamaru shook his head. Wait, WHAT? He continued shaking his head; where had THAT thought come from?

"M-Mister? A-are you alright?"

Akamaru stopped at this. E-eh? Composing himself, he looked down at the pup, who had his head tilted to the side. Thankfully, he appeared less scared and more confused...

Y-yeah, I'm OK, Akamaru assured the pup. After calming himself down a bit, he once again focused on the pup. Al-alright, I'm just gonna ask you a couple questions....

"Is this an interrogation?" the pup suddenly spoke up. "C-cause if it is, I really don't know anything; I just got a partner...."

Akamaru blinked. N-no, this isn't an interrogation; I just wanna know a few things. He took a breath. O-OK, first, your partner...what's their name?

At this, the pup perked up, his tail wagging. "Oh, that's easy! Tsume Inuzuka, of Konoha's Inuzuka clan!" He puffed his chest out adorably. "She's gonna be the clan head someday!"

Akamaru stared at the pup for a moment. O-OK, next question, Akamaru continued, partially to fend off the sense of weirdness that was emanating from the whole damn situation. H-how old is Tsume?

Kuromaru wagged his tail. "She just got into the academy!" He exclaimed, happy that he was doing so well with the grown-up dog's questions. "It's a place where people learn how to be ninjas!"

Uh-huh, Akamaru nodded slowly. OK, one more; I don't know if you know this, but the village's Hokage...which one is he?

At this, Kuromaru's expression brightened. "Oh, that's an easy one!" he exclaimed. "He's the Third Hokage! He's super nice and super smart, and he gives me treats sometimes!" Before Akamaru could react to this, Kuromaru piped up. "My turn! What's your name, Mister?"

M-mine...? Akamaru replied faintly. M-my name's Akamaru...

Kuromaru's eyes lit up. "Ooh! You have "maru" at the end of your name? Are you an Inuzuka dog too, 'cause I've never seen you before...are you living in another village, and have you ever been to Konoha, and...."

Akamaru jolted back, taken off-guard by the questions. Er...well, I live in Konoha, he began slowly, carefully choosing his words, but my partner and I have...errr... beeen away from the village for a while on a super-secret mission, and we haven't been back in a while....

Kuromaru's erect ear perked up. "Oh, so THAT'S why we haven't met!" he exclaimed, hopping to his paws. "Well, pleased to meetcha, Mister Akamaru!"

Akamaru twitched slightly; being called 'Mister' by Kuromaru was the LAST thing he'd ever expected to happen. N-nice to meet you too, Kuromaru...b-but what were you doing here?

"Oh, that's easy!" Kuromaru exclaimed happily. "Well, I went to sleep with Tsume after a day of training, and then I woke up here!" His smile faded a bit, and his ears drooped slightly. "Sh-she wasn't here, and I couldn't smell her...but it's all so pretty! I-I couldn't help wandering around, looking at everything...and-and then I smelled something SUPER yummy, and I saw this human who looked like he was from our clan eating a GINORMOUS steak!"

In spite of himself, Akamaru chuckled a bit. That'd be my partner, Kiba. He's got a bit of an appetite...

At this, the pup started hopping up and down. "Ooh! Can I go meet him? Pretty please? Ever since I woke up, I haven't had anyone to play with...."

Akamaru thought about this. On one hand, Kiba might freak out upon seeing Cute Little Cinnamon Roll...Kuromaru...but on the other hand, this could all be a really, really elaborate Genjutsu, and it might not matter...and besides, who knew? Kiba seeing Kuromaru as a cute little puppy might help him feel a little less terrified of his adult self...

Sure, we can go see him, Akamaru replied, wagging his tail in spite of himself. I'm sure he'd like to meet you.

"Yay!" Kuromaru exclaimed, his tail and rump wagging happily. He stopped suddenly, and he smiled sheepishly. "But, er...can I ride on your head? I, erm, kinda got tired form the running..."

Without thinking, Akamaru lowered himself to the ground. S-sure thing, kid....

Eagerly, Kuromaru ran up to Akamaru and jumped on his head, turning around so he faced the front before flopping down and sprawling out. Slowly, Akamaru got to his paws, and turned back to where he'd come from.

Kuromaru's a puppy, and he's riding on my head, Akamaru murmured. I must be in the Twilight Zone...whatever that is.

Shrugging, he began trotting off towards the clearing, Kuromaru resting on his head.

Upon reaching the clearing....
1153311222122222122.title: Kuro

choices: Kiba resumes chowing down on his massive steak
Kiba, still needing a moment, talks with Kuromaru some more.
11533112221222221222.content:
…Akamaru could see Kiba leaning back in his chair, hands rested firmly against his midsection, which a fairly decent sized chunk of the massive steak consumed…and an AMPLE amount to still needing to be consumed. His normally trim and flat stomach was currently pressing out against his red, slashed up t-shirt. To anyone else, it would appear as though he was dreadfully full. Akamaru, however, knew much better.

Well, I see you’ve made some progress, huh.

Kiba responded by burping forcefully then sighing and smacking his lips moments later. Akamaru simply blinked dully.

…I’ll take that as a ‘yes…’

The sound, however, earned a giggle from the pup currently riding atop Akamaru’s head, causing Kiba to blink in slight confusion.

“Oi, Akamaru, is that, y-?”

He trailed off when he saw the little pup riding atop Akamaru’s head, giggling with amusement as Akamaru chuckled in response.

So, you may not have noticed, but apparently, we had a little company…and I DO mean ‘little’…

Kiba nodded as he glanced down at the beaming pup. He couldn’t put his finger on it. Something about this happy little pup seemed familiar. But before he could inquire, the pup adjusted himself to make himself comfortable atop Akamaru’s head, causing one of his ears to flop over his eye. In that moment, Kiba’s eyes immediately went wide.

“…Akamaru, is this, who I think it is…?” the teen asked in shock, to which, Akamaru nodded ever so slightly. His response, however, contradicted the nod.

Why, Kiba, I think you might have this pup confused for somebody else. How about you introduce yourself, kid?

Kuromaru nodded then beamed happy at Kiba, tail and rump wagging happily as he answered. “Hiya! My name is Kuromaru! Nice to meetcha!”

Kiba blinked in confusion before turning his gaze back down to Akamaru.

Aren’t you gonna introduce yourself?

“R-right, right, erm, hey there. I’m Kiba,” the teen replied.

“Yep! Akamaru told me you were his partner, and that you two were on some super secret mission! Sounds super exciting!” Kuromaru remarked merrily. Earning a nod from Kiba, still keeping his gaze set on Akamaru with an eyebrow cocked. The large dog just shrugged his shoulders slightly.

“Uhhhh huh, super secret mission sounds about right…” replied Kiba.

The pup, meanwhile, turned his attention to that massive steak still being worked on.

“Wow! Mister Akamaru wasn’t kidding,” Kuromaru began, tail and rump once again wagging anew, “ya really DO have an appetite, Mister Kiba! Are you actually gonna finish this whole thing all by yourself?”

Despite his immense confusion, Kiba turned back to the steak and rubbed the back of his head.

“H-heh, well, that’s the plan, kiddo.”

“Woooooooow, that’s super cool! I mean, lookit how big y’er tummy got already! I bet it’ll be the size of a HOUSE by the time you’re done!”

Kiba’s face reddened a bit at that, but he was mainly just taken back by the pup who appeared to be the notorious hardass he’d come to know and fear for years…using the word ‘tummy’ in a sentence…

…Honestly, the whole thing was just surreal. But it was clear he couldn’t get answers so long as Kuromaru was around. To which, Akamaru was made aware of through reading his partners’ facial expressions.

Say, kid, umm, you mind giving Kiba’n I a few minutes? Super secret mission stuff…confidential, you know how it is.

“Oh! Sure, Mister Akamaru!”

So saying, Kiba lowered his head to the grass, giving Kuromaru a chance to hop off, and go scampering off, playing in the grass merrily, which, much to Akamaru’s surprise, caused his chest to hitch a bit. Kiba, on the other hand, was too taken back to appreciate how cute the little pup was being.

“…Okay, I need to know, am I going insane? Or is the big bad Kuromaru…a freakin’ puppy…?”

Unless we’re both going insane, that is exactly what is going on. And his body doesn’t seem to be the only thing regressed.

“Whadduya mean?”

Right now, his memories are as they were during the time of The Third Hokage. He genuinely thinks it’s around the time your mom graduated from the academy.

“…You’re kidding me…”

Wish I were. Kiba, I have no idea how or why this happened to him, or what the Hell is going on, but it’s very, VERY important that we don’t freak him out with the truth. Whatever is going on with him, we just…need to play along with until he’s back to normal.

“What if he DOESN’T go back to normal though…?”

Akamaru looked back at the puppy playing and rolling around in the grass from afar. For a SPLIT second, the prospect of the normally scary and imposing dog staying an adorable puppy didn’t exactly seem like the worst thing in the world.

…And that second lasted for another little while, but nonetheless…

We’ll figure something out. Don’t worry. But for now, you and I are just…members of the Inuzuka clan, you’ve never met Tsume, and we’ve been on a top secret mission. Sound good?

Kiba just nodded before turning back to the pup, and smirking slightly despite himself.

“…Heh, gotta admit, Kuromaru was a pretty damn adorable puppy, huh.”

…Yyyyyyyep. And get this, he’s hoping you can play with him at some point.

The teenage ninja snorted in surprise to that, but nonetheless, nodded before calling out to Kuromaru.

“Alright, lil guy, you’re clear.”

Perking up, the pup scampered back to the duo, tail and rump wagging as merrily as could be.

“So? Ya gonna go back to trying to finish that ginormous steak, Mister Kiba?” the puppy inquired, earning a chuckle from the teen before glancing back at the steak and pondering for a moment before answering…
11533112221222221222.title: Kiba is taking a break, allowing Akamaru to chat..

1153312.content: What about Luffy. D Monkey and the Straw Hat crew?
1153312.title: One Piece?

11533122.content: The element mages can put away some meals. How about it?

115331221.content: Shall we gain with Fire Mage Natsu Dragneel?
115331221.title: Fairy Tail!

1153312211.content: What kind of gain is it for the young fire mage?
1153312211.title: Natsu!

choices: Raid it of all its' food.
11533122111.content:
"Come on, that all you got, Dragon breath?!" shouted a shirtless Gray, panting as frost emanated from his clenched fists. Rising from a pile of broken crates he'd just recently been thrown into; young fire mage Natsu Dragneel, smirking and breathing heavily from exhaustion as he wiped a bit of blood from his mouth. "You kidding, Frosty? I'm just getting warmed up..." said Natsu as fire pulsed through his fists. With two simultaneous battle-cries, both mages charged at one another, exchanging blow for blow, with neither one showing any signs of slowing down anytime soon.

Wrapping his fist into a ball of ice, Gray drove it straight into Natsu's stomach, knocking the wind out of him as he stumbled back, clutching his abdomen in pain. Smirking, Gray stepped towards the winded Natsu, seemingly victorious. "Ready to give up now, Natsu?" asked Gray. No response.

Instead, an open mouthed grin grew over the fire mage's face, catching Gray's attention. "Two words, Snowball....Fire Floor..." said Natsu as smoke began to emit from the floor beneath Gray. Wide eyed, Gray slowly glanced down, but before he could act, a torrent of fire roared from the floor beneath him, consuming him in a massive ball of flame for a few seconds before Natsu ended his attack, leaving Gray standing in the same position, smoldering, charred, and flabbergast. "Whadduya say we just call it a draw...?" asked Natsu.
"..........deal."

Coughing from the smoke, Gray wiped some of the char from his sore body and looked down to see Natsu still a bit winded, then offered his hand to help him up. Looking up, Natsu smirked wearily and took his rival-friend's hand as he pulled him up from the ground.

Suddenly a loud rumble emitted within the Guild's training room. Blushing, Natsu grinned innocently as the source of the loud noise was revealed to be to his six pack laden stomach. "Ehhh heheh...guess whooping your butt kind of worked up an appetite," said Natsu, causing Gray to glare back furiously and say, "Whooping my butt?! I was kicking your ass left and right! The only reason we tied was cause you pulled that cheapshot on me like-" before Gray could rant further, a similar rumbling emitted from his own bare stomach, causing him to blush with embarrassment as Natsu laughed and nudged Gray on the shoulder.

"Ahhh, save it for next time, Ice-Brain. For now, let's get some grub!"
"Works for me."

The two head over to the kitchen, and...
11533122111.title: Dragonslayer's appetite

choices: One of them begins to feel unwell.
115331221111.content:
Both boys headed towards the kitchen. Natsu investigated the pantries while Gray kept watch and made sure no one else was coming. "C'mon, some time today, Natsu!" rushed Gray as he continued to nervously keep watch. Natsu simply brushed him off as he checked for what was good and what could stay uneaten. In his search, a wonderful aroma caught Natsu by surprise. Sniffing towards the source of the scent, he discovered a large cauldron of noodles, and next to it, two trays of assorted tempura with two glasses of what smelled like fruit juice next to them, almost perfectly assembled for two certain hungry young mages. Glaring wide eyed and mouth watering, Natsu; in an almost trance-like state, signaled for Gray to head over. As he did, Gray too, found himself almost mesmerized by the wonderfully cooked feast waiting to happen. "Ohhh man, do you know how long it's been since I had tempura...?" asked Gray to no one in particular. Meanwhile Natsu, still oogly eyed at the lovely meal beset before him, simply shrugged as he took a tray and took a big whiff of the battered shrimp, moaning with delight as the delightful scent wafted through his nostrils.

"Ohhhh yeah, now that's a meal fit for a champ..." said Natsu as he rubbed his rumbling stomach with anticipation. "Champ's don't tie with other champs, idiot," responded Gray. Too hungry to care, Natsu simply took his tray aside, then scooped himself a bowl of noodles, and immediately began chowing down. Gray did the same.

Taking a large chomp out of a piece of tempura, Natsu chewed vigorously and moaned with delight before gulping down the shrimp. "Mmmm! That might be the best tempura I've ever eaten!" said Natsu as he immediately continued to stuff his face with more shrimp. Much to his surprise, Gray found himself shoveling bits and bits of tempura down his throat like clockwork, chewing and gulping down multiple pieces at once, he sighed with relief and gave his toned bare stomach a hearty pat.

After some time, Natsu had downed a good majority of his tempura, leaving only a few as he gulped down a large quantity from his throat down to his gullet. Upon doing so, Natsu felt a great amount of pressure rise from his stomach as he clutched his abdomen in slight discomfort.

"Something wrong, Pyro-lips?" asked a half serious Gray as he began to gulp down noodles. Natsu simply shook his head as he clutched onto his abs firmly. His painful moaning suggested perhaps he wasn't feeling so hot. This attitude soon changed as a loud rumble emitted from within Natsu's gut, and with a few hard thumps to his chest, Natsu was able to push out a void and lengthy belch, whch carried on for close to seven seconds before Natsu had to take a breath. Gray rolled his eyes as Natsu sighed with sweet relief and gave his belly a hearty pat. Much to Natsu's surprise, his meal thus far had taken quite a tole on his sculpture perfect physique. His lower stomach, while still firm and muscle laden, had began to bulge outward by few inches. Prodding at his gut, Natsu glared wide eye then smirked.

"Huh....it would appear as though I'm also kicking your ass at eating too," he said with a blatant coyness that only Gray would get annoyed by...which he was.
"Oh what?! Now you think you can down more than me?!" barked Gray.
Natsu grinned toothily and said, "Hey, nothing to be ashamed of, Not-So-Fullbuster. Some people can just stomach more than others." He said with a smirk as he slapped his belly for emphasis and began to get back to work on his meal. Furious, Gray began to down his meal at a quicker rate than before...
115331221111.title: Raid it of all its' food.

1153312211112.content: Which one overdoes their stuffing?
1153312211112.title: One of them begins to feel unwell.

choices: Gray gives Natsu a belly rub to ease his pain
11533122111121.content:
Both boys were now stuffing their faces at rapid paces. " *SLUUURRRRP* Feel free to *munch* give up whenever you're ready to *GULP* admit that I'm number one, snow-boy!" taunted Natsu between bite after bite of his large meal. Gray did his best to block out his obnoxious rival with the sound of consumption. "Uh huh, *CRUNCH!* and you can *GULP* feel free to kiss my ass, dragon-breath!" responded Gray as he took another mouthful of Tempura and gulped it down immediately after.

Neither one showed any signs of slowing down as they continued scarfing down their large meal at record paces. Meanwhile, both their bellies continued to slowly bloat outward with every mouthful of food gulped down. Natsu's stomach stuck outward by a few inches, creating a noticeable bulge from his unbuttoned vest, while Gray's stomach had only just begun to bloat up, creating just the slightest of bulges in his abs. After several moments of consumption, Gray had to stop for a moment and rest his hand on his strained abdomen, rubbing it up and down as he winced with moderate discomfort. "Awwww, does the abominable snowmage have a tummy ache?" asked Natsu sarcastically as he helped himself to another piece of tempura. "Yeah, you keep it up, flame boy, it's just gonna make me beating you taste all that much sweeter…" responded Gray as he swallowed down his discomfort and went back to stuffing his face against Natsu. Little by little, both their six pack laden stomachs continued to swell up. Natsu continued to taunt Gray at every opportunity between bites of food, or slurps of ramen, but Gray did his best to block Natsu's obnoxiousness out, and kept trying his hardest to keep up, swallowing beyond his fill again and again. However, as he glanced down, his gradually expanding stomach began to gurgle violently.

Starting to feel the strain, Gray slowed down, resting one hand on his bloated stomach, rubbing it firmly in an effort to ease his pain while Natsu continued to scarf his face like no tomorrow. Burping queasily, Gray moaned in pain as he began to look and feel a bit nauseous, but Natsu paid no heed to his rivals suffering, only packing away as much of it into his gullet as he possibly could. "Ugh, *hic* screw it, you *urrrrp* win, Dragon-Breath…" said a stuffed Gray, barely stifling another wet burp with his fist.

But even after Gray had just admitted defeat, Natsu still continued to scarf down what remained on his plate. Gray looked flabbergast, albeit still very stuffed. "Natsu…you won, why are you still eating?" asked Gray, to which Natsu; after taking a hearty gulp of his meal, replied, "Because there's still food on my plate?"

Gray's jaw almost dropped from his skull, before he blurted out, "How the HELL can you still be eating?!?!" Natsu greedily slurped up the remains of his ramen bowl, and sighed heartily with a smile on his face afterward.

"Ahhh, y'know one of the beauties of being a fire mage, Gray? I'm always fired up in just the right places!" responded Natsu, before rubbing his noticeably bloated but still muscle bound belly for emphasis. "Thanks to all the fire I got stored up in the ol' tank, I can digest and burn these goodies off way quicker, which makes stuffing it all that more enjoyable. I can eat til I'm about to burst, but in a few hours, I'll be right as rain! Unfortunately, you and your frosty digestive system proooooobably can't say the same, can ya?"
"Oh screw off…" responded Gray.
"Now, if you'll excuse me…."

Natsu once again turned his attention to what remained of his and now Gray's unfinished meal, and with a lick of the lips, once again, went to town. Fed up, Gray took his leave, one hand still rested on his bloated stomach, leaving Natsu to greedily consume everything on the table. But after some time had passed…

*BUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRPPPP!*

Natsu groaned in pain after unleashing a rather loud belch as he massaged his painfully bloated midsection. Hearing the loud eruption of noise, Gray returned to the kitchen; his stomach slightly less bloated, and found Natsu sprawled on the floor, clutching his bloated belly in pain. After such a lengthy gorging, Natsu's belly had bloated outward by close to eight inches, sticking outward like a tiny beach ball. Seeing this; Gray smirked cockily.

"Awwww, something wrong? Does the big bad dragon breather have a tummy ache?" taunted Gray, enjoying Natsu's comeuppance before he continued with, "but I thought your fire guts would'a burned up all that food by now, what's the hold up?" But Natsu gave no response, instead his stomach gave one for him by gurgling in a vicious manner, causing Natsu to grit in sheer agony.

Suddenly Gray stopped smirking, and a look of slight concern grew over his face. "…H-hey, you okay, lava brain?"
"Rgh, do I look okay, dumbs?" responded Natsu with an undercurrent of great pain in his voice. "Ugh, I dunno what's wrong with my stomach, it usually digests by now."
"Do you usually eat THAT much?"
"….N-not really…."
"Well, maybe if you hadn't been such an arrogant prick; stuffing your stupid face even after I admitted defeat, you wouldn't be in this mess."
"Y'know, SHOCKINGLY, that's not really all that helpful right now, you jackass…"

Rolling his eyes, Gray pondered for a solution…
11533122111121.title: Dragonslayer's bellyache

choices: Only to get busted immediately after.
115331221111211.content:
Suddenly a light bulb lit up in Gray's head, followed by a disgruntled sigh as he approached the obnoxious fire mage. "Okay, I think I know how to solve your dilemma, buuuuuut it's gonna be a little weird," said Gray as he looked away a bit nervously. "Weird how?" asked Natsu, between bouts of pain surging from his stuffed stomach. His answer came when Gray placed his right palm atop Natsu's bare bloated stomach. His eyes widened with surprise as he immediately slapped Gray's hand away.

"Hey man, what the hell are you doing?!"
"Oh, stop being such a baby. Lucy showed me this little trick. Whenever Happy overdoes it on the fish, she gives him a little belly rub and he's right as rain."
"I'M NOT A FLYING CAT, YOU DOLT!"
"No, you're a hot headed doofus who doesn't know when to quit. Now do you want my help or not?"

A silence grew over the two, until another painful rumble emitted from Natsu's stomach, causing him to wince in pain, then, after a reluctant pause, eventually nodded to Gray. "Just so we're clear, you say one word about this to anyone, and I will light your ass on fire for the rest of the week!" Warned Natsu, causing Gray simply to roll his eyes as he once again placed his right palm flat atop Natsu's distended stomach. Natsu jerked slightly. "Jeez, forgot how icy your hands are...."
"Any second you wanna stop talking is fine by me," responded Gray as he began to gently rub Natsu's stomach in a slow circular motion, feeling his painfully distended abs, hard as stone from the amount of content currently just sitting within the Dragonslayer's belly. Gray couldn't help but admire the sheer size of Natsu's stomach given it was only one; albeit massive, meal.

"Man, guess you really put in your work, didn't you, Natsu?" No response. "Natsu?" Gray took his focus from Natsu's bloated gut and towards Natsu himself, and much to his surprise, Natsy appeared to be smiling, almost as if he were in a state of transcendence and relaxation. "Enjoying yourself?" asked Gray.
"Dude, I don't know what to say, but, this actually feels pretty nice..." responded Natsu. Not at all what Gray was expecting the Fire Mage to say. "Do me a favor though, could you try a little higher? That's where my stomach's really been killing me."

Shrugging, Gray moved up to a tender place atop Natsu's stomach and slowly stroked away. Natsu moaned with relief. "Ohhh yeah, there's the spot. Please, don't stop, man..." Complying, Gray kept at it, until he felt Natsu's abs tense up. "Something wrong?" asked Gray. Natsu didn't respond, instead a large bulge rose from his throat and up towards his cheeks, until Natsu opened his mouth wide.

*bbbBBBBBRRRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAPPPPPPP!*

Out came a wet, fiery belch. Along with it, came a mild sprout of flames, followed by smoke. Natsu sighed with relief as both he and Gray couldn't help but laugh.
