1153312212111.content:
Both boys stared wide eyed and mouths watering at a shiny newly seasoned rack of Lamb just waiting for the devouring on the table. Both mages looked around, spotted none of the other guild members. "It's all ours..." said Natsu. With that, the two dug right in. Both were shoveling chunks of meat down their throats at record paces, neither showing any signs of stopping. Suddenly a loud banging sounded from the kitchen door. "ARE YOU EATING OUR LAMB?!!" screamed Erza, but Gray immediately froze the door while stuffing his face at the same time. Natsu, mouth full of beef, glanced back and said, "Mmmmppf, you realize that we're dead, right?"
"*SLLURRRP!* Yup. But at least we won't die hungry!" responded Gray between bites.

Some time had passed and Natsu was leaning back against his chair with both hands resting on his extended stomach which stuck out slightly from his open vest. "Ahhhh *URP* that hit the spit, eh Gray?" Natsu paused for a moment, then glanced back at Gray, only to see him still stuffing his face with lamb. He raised his eyebrows in awe, that someone so small could still be eating a meal so massive. Looking down, Natsu also noticed that Gray's six pack had bloated out considerably from the massive intake of food. "Ummmmm....y-you might wanna slow it down a tad, Fullbuster..." said an uneasy Natsu. But Gray wasn't hearing it. Still, he stuffed himself silly, until finally, the entire platter was nothing but a pile of bones.

Picking his teeth of some leftover meat remnants, Gray leaned back as his far more extended stomach pushed outward a good few inches. "Ahhh, that was fantastic..." said Gray as he rested one hand atop his bloated belly. He then felt a rumbling emit from his stomach and immediately opened his mouth.

*BBBBBBBBBBBUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRPPP !* Gray unleashed a massive and lengthy belch with carried out for several seconds before winding down. Sighing heartily, Gray gave his belly a few pats before rubbing it up and down. "Hehe, s'cuse me..." he said, clearly not too bothered by his lack of manners. Meanwhile, Natsu was in utter awe. "That was...pretty damn awesome!" thought Natsu as he almost admired Gray's bloated gut.

Just then...
1153312212111.title: Gray eats Erza's lamb

choices: Gray started to really like this feeing of fullness.
Natsu liked watching Gray stuff himself raw.
11533122121112.content:
As the two sat in satisfied bliss, a loud rumbling emitted from Gray's bloated gut.

*GGGGGGUUUUUUUURRRRGGGGLLLLEEEEE!*

Natsu glances back at Gray's stomach. "Was that your stomach?" he asked. Gray winced, but smirked, "That; Fire Breath, is the sound of me finally landing victory over you," he said before giving his belly a hearty slap. The gurgling grew louder however, like that of a bubbling pot, growing more and more painful for the boy, even if he wouldn't admit it. Natsu glanced for a moment, then stared back at Gray. "You okay?"
*urrrrp* "Yeah, my gut's just a little raw, right now..." he said, trying to mask the pain in his voice.

Rolling his eyes, Natsu finally got up, sat down next to Gray and began rubbing his stomach with one hand. Gray's eyes widened with shock as he glanced back at Natsu. "Hey, w-what the hell are you-" Gray began, but stopped as Natsu continued and cut him off.
"Oh just shut up and relax, Blizzard Brain, I know what I'm doing." responded Natsu as he continued to rub Gray's bloated stomach in circular strokes. "Starting to feel a little better?" asked Natsu.
Gray paused, letting Natsu continue, and oddly enough, his bellyache had subsided a considerable amount. "Y-yeah actually..." responded Gray as he let Natsu do his thing.
"I get carried away all the time, so after a really big meal, nothing settles my stomach quite like a good tummy rub. Though, I've never eaten anywhere NEAR as much as you just did. You really put it away, didn't ya?" laughed Natsu. Gray merely smirked and shrugged. As it continued, Natsu's rubbing worked up some of the excess pressure building in Gray's stomach since his hearty meal.

*uuuurrrrrrrrrrp!* "Man, I gotta admit, Natsu, this actually *URP* feels really good *UUUUURRRRRP!* said Gray between burps. Suddenly a loud rumbling emitted from his stomach, forcing out a massive

*BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR RRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP!!!!!*

Gray unleashed perhaps his loudest and longest belch yet, carrying out for a good 10 seconds before reaching an apex. After a moment of silence, both young mages laughed heartily. "Hahaha, NICE one, man!" said Natsu as he patted Gray's belly. Gray merely smirked, letting out a smaller burp, and said, "Now if THAT wasn't teamwork, I don't know what is..."

Both boys laughed again, as it began to dawn that...
11533122121112.title: Gray's stomach rumbled.

The three eldest: Osomatsu, Karamatsu, and Choromatsu.

How will they gain weight?
11533122222222211.title: the Three Eldest

115331222222222112.content:
The Matsuno sextuplets weren't productive members of society. To be more precise, they were NEETs: they never went to college, never bothered to get a job, and weren't actively looking to get a job either. People considered them on the lowest rank of of the social ladder, and them not having girlfriends didn't help either. Jobless, lowly virgins. That's all people considered them.

The three eldest were currently on a walk through town. Osomatsu was trying to catch some glances at pretty women, Karamatsu was attempting to walk in a confident stride, and Choromatsu was dedicated to making sure the two didn't embarrass themselves today.

"Man, I really need some money..." Osomatsu sighed, stopping in front of his brothers. Karamatsu bumped into him, nearly tripping over as Choromatsu helped held him up by his leather jacket.

"We could get a job..." Choromatsu suggested, even if he knew that Osomatsu would reject it. Sure enough, he didn't even acknowledge his statement, mind racing for some sort of scheme.

"Isn't there some sort of get rich quick thing we can do? Like getting first place in a contest or something? Ugh, making money is so hard...!"

Choromatsu rolled his eyes. Osomatsu wasn't anywhere close to acting like the eldest brother, always abusing his position to wring favors out of the other five.

"Brother, I think I found a solution." Karamatsu held up a flyer that had blown into his face, detailing an eating contest event. Osomatsu immediately grabbed for it, eyes widening with every sentence before getting to the cash prize.

"100,000 yen?" His jaw dropped, eyes practically yen symbols as he imagined the possibilities. "Guys, we gotta enter! The contest starts in two weeks, we need to practice!"

"You just want an excuse to pig out!" Choromatsu scolded. But still, 100,000 yen was nothing to sneeze at. All the idol merchandise he could buy with that money would be unbelievable.

"Alright! Starting today, the eldest three Matsu brothers will compete to win 100,000 yen! Winner takes all!" Osomatsu grinned from ear-to-ear, clearly the most enthusiastic about the contest. He loved all types of food, there was no way he was going to lose to Karamatsu or Choromatsu.

"I accept your challenge, my brother," Karamatsu said with a twinkle in his eye.

"Fine..." Choromatsu sighed. "But where are we going to practice at?"

115332.content: What about those Werewolves of Beacon Hills?
115332.title: Teen Wolf

choices: Derek and Peter at a restaurant
11533211222.content:
After the defeat of the Darach things seemed to be settling down, for the moment anyhow. At least a reprieve was something to be glad about licking their wounds after the conflict between Deucalion and Jennifer. Stile’s dad was okay and had even been brought into the loop about the supernatural activities that had been going on in their town which meant Stiles was finally free of the guilt he had been feeling on keeping things hidden and having to be sneaky. Everything seemed good but little did they know something different was about to happen…

Derek was out for a run when he felt it. Glancing up he saw the partly full moon and his face morphed for a moment before he realized it without meaning to. Concentrating, he shifted back but shivered feeling the urge to transform crawl under his skin. This was unusual since usually he could voluntarily control it and it had been a long time since he lost it on a day that wasn’t a full moon. It grew stronger and he ran his tongue along his fangs. Most unexpected and a bit worrisome because if he was losing control without meaning to on a day that wasn’t a full moon there could be trouble. He better talk to Peter to see if he knew anything about it as his uncle knew pretty much everything about werewolves and what he didn’t Dr. Deaton would probably know (why he posed as an ordinary vet Derek didn’t know). Running back, Derek headed back to the apartment house where the Pack were living.

“Peter where are you?” Derek called out and Peter appeared giving a yawn.
“What is it Derek? I was napping,” Peter said rubbing his eyes. Derek snorted not caring as he tapped his foot and Peter shrugged as he came down the stairs.
“Uncle, something weird happened while I was out on my run today,” Derek stated.

“Yeah?” Peter said sarcastically. Clearly there had to have been if Derek came in out of schedule shouting for him during his naptime. It was one of the sucky things about getting old, he felt so tired, especially since his werewolf powers had been alternately waning and coming back. However after Derek had given him some of his powers Peter had been feeling better, his body just needed to adjust after the upshot that had felt like after a stimulant.

“I changed partially without meaning too,” Derek said. He waited a moment while Peter stared at him before shock registering.
“You…oh,” Peter said. That was weird since Derek usually had amazing control of himself barring the full moon days.

“Yeah. Any ideas?” Peter was about to say something but then he saw the moon outside and something strange came over him and next thing he was running his tongue over his own fangs. His fangs! He hadn’t been able to shift ever since coming back from the dead but now he was getting it back. Derek stared at him and Peter growled at him, feeling powerful at the rumble of his chest compressing that sound.

“You’ve…changed,” Derek said surprised.
“Apparently so,” Peter said snapping his teeth together.
“But how?” Derek asked.

“I have no idea, but I like it.” Peter said, going over to a mirror and checking out his face, the morphed back, eyes squinting, hairy, elongated nose, and large inscissors for snapping with each tooth razor sharp. “I missed feeling this.”

“I don’t know if that is a good idea.” Derek said, staring suspiciously at Peter.
“Derek, don’t you trust me yet? You should know I don’t want to kill you. In fact I’ve only helped.”
“I guess…I just can’t help it,” Derek said. “You know after killing my sister to become Alpha and then trying to kill me.”

“Good points but I have changed a bit after dying. Anyhow, I don’t know what’s going on so we should talk to the other person who might know. That druid Deaton.” Derek nodded in agreement and they both went to the clinic where they could find him.

“Scott, is Deaton in?” demanded Derek brusquely, in that straight to the point manner he always had.
“Hey Derek,” Scott rolled his eyes a moment when he thought Derek wasn’t looking. “He’s in the back with a patient.”
“Well when he’s done we need to talk to him,” Derek stated.
“About what?” Scott asked confused.
“Some weird things that have been happening. Have you seen the moon lately?”
“No why?”
“I changed partially while running and not voluntarily.”
“That doesn’t sound good,” Scott said worried.
“No duh Scott and Peter has changed too.”
“Peter too?!” Scott shouted loudly and worried. “But…”
“Yeah, Peter.”
“I am right here you know,” Peter said sarcastically. “Nice to be talked about as if I’m not.”
“But you changed!” Scott said, staring suspiciously at Peter and Peter felt the urge to growl back and his fangs came down. Oh magnificence it felt good.
“Oh my god,” Scott said staring at Peter.
“I agree,” Peter said pleasantly while giving a creepy smile to Scott just to make him jump. “I am getting my powers back.”
“But how?” Scott demanded.
“Well saving Cora, Derek lent me some of his…”
“You did what?!” Scott shouted.
“I lent some of my power to heal Cora so keep up Scott.”
“Yes, please do Scott. The issue isn’t the return of my powers but the uncontrolled transition my nephew Derek has gone through.”
“What’s going on?” Deaton asked coming out.
“Peter has powers!” Scott shouted.
“I transformed,” Derek said at the same time.
"What?” Deaton said confused.
“Peter and Derek have shifted,” Scott said.
“It’s the Awakening moon coming up.” They all stared blankly at him and Deaton sighed.

“A special time that happens every now and then, generally following once a century period where werewolves go through a special…puberty type transformation.”
“Werewolf puberty? Really?” Scott asked. “I thought we already did that when transitioning.

“Well yes but a different type where those with the lupine bloodline go through a super-transformation thing. For the next few months or so, sometimes longer but usually months, your werewolf powers will be volatile and could come or go at random moments, uncontrollable shifts, spurts of energy, extreme hunger, total body transformations…”

“Is it dangerous?” Scott asked.

“Potentially. However it won’t drive you crazy during the full moon. In fact, in the midst of this transitioning stage, you will no longer completely lose yourself to the bestial side during the full moon and would be able to retain one’s rational capacities. It’ll be random shifts from human to wolf and in between but you wouldn’t actually notice it unless you focus as your thought processes will be continuous and one might not even be aware they shifted.”

“So…this is natural?” Derek asked.

“Yes, in fact it is a blessing since you could reach full potential and retain oneself even in the midst of a full on full moon not to mention even more strength and powers.” Deaton explained. “However this will require a lot of energy to fuel so expect to be hungry all the time hence the super-transformation.”

“So…how come Scott hasn’t yet?” Derek asked.

"He has to see or come in contact with the moon and he’s been in here with me all day. He will almost certainly be affected and shift to some degree as soon as he goes outside.”

“Will we be able to go to school?” Scott asked.

“I would not really recommend that. Though the likelihood of harm coming to anyone else is rather small assuming no extreme mood swinging, the random shifts might not be a good thing to show in school. I’d withdraw for the rest of the semester and continue your education another way for these next few months.”

“Well dang. Wait, is this going to affect everyone?” Scott asked.
“Yes, it will affect all werewolves nearby.”
“I’ll need to talk to Isaac and the twins,” Scott said getting up.
“Okay,” Derek said. “You can stay with us while we’re all going through this…Awakening thing.”

“Sure, I got to tell my mom and Allison as well.” Derek rolled his eyes. Of course Scott did but grudgingly Derek was beginning to like her and Mr. Argent . Gerard was another story but it was good to have honorable hunters that he could work with.

“Fine then, just come over later and bring Stiles with you.” Derek nodded to Scott and left with Peter, shivering as he felt the moon upon him with whatever weird power was going on. It made him feel alive but it also made him extremely…hungry.

“Err, want to stop somewhere to eat?” Derek asked Peter. He wasn’t really in the mood to go hunting after fresh game at the moment.
“Yeah,” Peter said.
11533211222.title: The Awakening Moon

choices: The next morning Peter and Derek realize they've gained some weight.
115332112221.content:
Derek and Peter both loaded themselves into Derek's car and they drove off from Deacon's parking lot, "Any place you have in mind?" Derek asked his uncle.
"Hmmm" Peter thought, wondering where they could go. Almost like clockwork both his and Derek's stomachs let out a loud grumble in desperate need of food. Peter chucked, "Well, I guess a small dinner just won't cut it, huh?" Peter asked.
"Guess not." Derek replied as he drove. Out of the corner of his eye Peter noticed a billboard advertising a new buffet in town, "How about we go there? The place is called...The Gut Buster. It's a new buffet."
"I don't know..." Peter said, looking down at his abs, "I don't wanna gain any weight.."
Just then the sound of two loud growls came from both of their bellies, once again simultaneously, and Peter sighed, "Sure, why not."

Peter and Derek pulled into the parking spot they were lucky enough to find in the very front of the tightly packed parking lot. They both headed inside to the buffet, which they were honestly surprised to see had been built right next door to a gym, and were quickly lead to their table. Peter and Derek set their phones and receipt down before they both headed over in silence to the buffet and started loading up on food. Both men decided on steak but they differed on everything else. Derek's first plate was 3 massive steaks, almost an entire plate of mashed potatoes covered in cheese, and an entire second plate of cheesy bread while Peter had 2 steaks, 3 baked potatoes with all the toppings, and an entire bowl of macaroni and cheese. Derek and Peter weren't the most talkative duo but tonight not a single word would be said between them at dinner. Both wolves sat down at their table and wasted no time digging in.

The second food touched their lips both of them became ravenous and tore into their meat like actual wolves, though they never shifted into their wolf forms. They had both devoured their first big courses in a matter of minutes and the second their plates were clean they went for more, both of them getting the same things. Normally neither Peter nor Derek could eat more than a second helping but thanks to the Awakening Moon they couldn't seem to stop and the two ate and ate and ate. Peter groaned as he finally came to a complete and total stop when it came to eating. The older werewolf slumped back in his seat and groaned as he rubbed his bloated stomach, "Oh God.... I've never eaten that much in my life." Peter said, looking at the stack of 10 plates. Derek added his twelfth plate to his stack and grinned at Peter, picking at his teeth with a claw, "Already full, uncle? Shame I thought you could have eaten more."

"You're lucky I'm so full or I'd punch you in the face." Peter said, burping and rubbing his sore, bloated belly which was trapped underneath his skin tight shirt.
Derek stood up, revealing his massive belly, which was far bigger than Peter's, "Yeah, I'm getting pretty full too." Derek said, rubbing his also trapped belly, "But I think I have room for dessert." Derek said walking slowly to the desert table. The bloated wolf returned with a massive sundae covered in a mountain of whipped cream and chocolate syrup. Derek started eating and Peter groaned again before speaking,
"You know.." he began, "This must be that extreme hunger Deacon was talking about."
"Yeah, Derek said between bites, "I'll be honest though it's pretty fun eating like this."
"Yeah, it is."

After 10 minutes Derek and done and was equally as bloated and full as Peter, his belly far larger in size. When the two stood up they realized their skin tight shirts couldn't contain the size of their bloated guts; The bottom of Peter's was sticking out from under his shirt and Derek's was up far past his belly button. The two groaned as they headed to Derek's care to go home; tired, bloated, and ready to pass out.
115332112221.title: Stuffed Wolves

choices: The Meeting, and suddenly they all get hungry and have a group feeding session
Derek and Peter were not the only ones affected so far (the night before)
1153321122211.content:
Derek was not sure how they managed to get home in the building they were staying at but somehow Derek had managed to drive home, park, and climb up the steps with Peter, say goodnight, and get into his bed where he immediately passed out in blessed sleep. He slept for hours until the knocking of the front door entered his consciousness and he groaned as he got up and stretched. He was still tired so he hoped the person would either go away or he was going to have to scare them off as he was not in the mood for this. Mumbling death threats, Derek sleepily made his way down the staircase and to the front door and opened it where he was greeted with the surprising appearance of one Stiles Stilinski who was way too chipper and animated for this ungodly hour.

"Hey Derek! Scott told me that he was bringing everyone here in a bit and that he had something to say, though I don't know why he didn't tell me right then but I just came early with snacks and what not because he did say you guys were going to need some and..." Stiles took a look at Derek and stared, his mouth trailing off in surprise. Derek raised his eyebrow and wondered what had distracted Stiles since it looked like he was going to pass out in a moment. His feet sure looked shaky and before Stiles did, Derek grabbed him and plopped Stiles on a couch who had not stopped staring, his mouth fluttering a bit. Beginning to get worried and a bit creeped out, Derek backed up.

"What is it?" He asked, his voice coming out in a growl and he realized his face had shifted so with extreme concentration forced it back. "What is it?" Derek tried again sounding human. There, that was much better. Stiles's mouth fluttered a few more times with nothing before he visibly straightened up and pull himself together.

"Well uh...you look different," Stiles said quickly. Derek stared at him not understanding.
"What?" Derek asked.

"You look different," Stiles repeated staring him in the eyes which normally he didn't do. Derek looked confused until he looked down at his hands, legs, and...belly. Going to the repaired full length mirror, Derek stopped and stared in front of it, Stiles close behind. His tiredness gone, Derek could only stare in disbelief and a bit of horror as he stared at himself, though more disbelieving. He was still wearing the clothes he went to sleep in which was a black sleeveless tanktop and jeans. He was covered in hair. His arms were hairy, his legs were hairy, his chest, his beard looked wild and thick and the hair on his head was all over the place. Also was the fact that his tanktop, normally stretched tight against his flat ripped well-muscled stomach (Derek wasn't normally vain but he did think it a point of pride of good maintenance and well-keeping) was no longer flat but kind of bowed out with the definition warped and kind of faded under the new light covering of fine dark hair. The covering of the shirt was pushed up, exposing his hairy gut. To his horror when Derek jiggled it, it did a little and felt kind of fleshy though at least not as soft as he had worried (yet).

"What the hell?" Derek said stunned. Stiles who had been surreptitiously eying him straightened up.

"You look pretty hairy," Stiles said without thinking and poked Derek in the gut, "Man you've really let yourself go, I hear there is a new gym opening and you might want to go to fix this before it becomes permanent." Derek stared death at him and Stiles backed up. "I'm sorry uh...I don't know what's going on, please don't hurt me!" Derek snorted and returned to staring at the mirror in bewilderment while Stiles gathering his courage poked Derek in the gut again. "Hehe fun," he said feeling it and getting out of Derek's reach when his hands went out to catch him. Normally Stiles would have stood no chance but Derek was out of it still staring so he barely missed grabbing Stiles. Soon they heard Peter come down and they both turned to look at him. Upon seeing their shocked faces Peter stared back.

"What?" he asked before he caught sight of Derek and his mouth dropped open. Derek and Stiles both stared at him as he was covered in hair as well and while not to the extent of Derek, he was definitely looking a bit furry with his normally clean shaven face covered in scruff as well as a thick coating on his arms, assumably his legs though they were covered by his pants, and definitely his chest and gut as well which poked from underneath his shirt.

"Well...this is...interesting," Derek said, not quite sure what to say as he and Peter stared in shock at each other.
"Uh, yeah, though I wouldn't really say that," Peter mumbled, taking a view of himself in the mirror and wincing.
"So what's going on?" Stiles asked confused, reminding them that he was there as well.
"The Awakening Moon, did Scott tell you about it yet?" Derek asked. Stiles shook his head no and Derek rubbed his forehead.
"Okay, okay, its pretty much a werewolf puberty transition stage caused by a special moon every hundred years or so..." Derek explained to Stiles all they had learned so far from Deaton.

"Wow, that's weird." Stiles said after they explained. "Werewolf puberty? I hated going through puberty once, I can't imagine going through it a second time. So what you're saying is that you guys, Scott, and everyone will be going through this weird growing phase over the next few months?"

"Yes," Derek replied. "All werewolves that come in contact with the moon."
"But why?" Stiles asked. "What's so special about this moon that causes it?"
"I don't know it just does," Derek said again his temper rising.
"But aren't you wondering..." Stiles started and all of a sudden he was up against a wall with Derek's clawed hand on his throat looking into red eyes.

"Shut up," Derek growled, his voice amplified by his transition into his alpha form. Normally Stiles would be scared, and make no mistake he was, but he also found it oddly arousing Derek being so close to him, pushing him against a wall and Derek's thicker gut brushing his. He smelled some sort of natural forest musky animal Derek smell and Stiles smiled briefly as he turned and offered his neck in submission without realizing he did so. Derek's eyes glared red for one more moment before turning back to normal and the squeezing hand removed. Stiles was oddly disappointed when Derek stepped away. "I'm sorry," Derek murmured. Stiles blinked and stared. Did he just hear right?

"What was that?" Stiles asked.
"I'm sorry," Derek repeated looking abashed. "I lost control for a second."
"It's okay, you didn't hurt me," Stiles said to the suddenly upset Derek. "You got it back."
"I could have hurt you," Derek pointed out.
"Yeah, but you didn't. Besides, you threaten to hurt me a lot of times." Stiles said.
"I'm sorry," Derek said again, looking almost...were those seriously tears? Unsure what to do with a suddenly emotional Derek, Stiles looked to Peter who looked as baffled as he did and Stiles hesitantly put his arm around Derek.

"Uh...it's okay...and stuff...dude you're seriously freaking me out, please stop crying." Stiles said as he patted Derek. Derek glared at him a moment and the sniffling stopped which made Stiles feel relieved.

"You seriously suck at comforting people. Even I can do better than that," Derek said in his normal tone of voice.
"Yeah, I guess I do. That sure would be a sight to see though, you comforting people. How would it go? 'Stop crying or I'll rip your throat out so you can't anymore?'" Derek grinned.

"Yeah, something like that. It works though."
"Only because it scares the crap out of them...anyhow that was...something different," Stiles said. "I don't know if I can handle all you guys going through such hormonal mood swings for the next couple months with PWSing" Derek and Peter looked at him.

"You know, like PMSing for girls but with the M flipped over for werewolves and the fact that you are all pretty much guys and from what you describe it's going to be for the next couple months. Wait, what about Cora? Will she go through it too?"

"I guess so," Peter said shrugging. "Speaking of, where is she? I haven't seen her yet." As if saying her name summoned her, there was a loud yawn coming from upstairs and Cora padded out to the top of the staircase. She still looked pale and sickly but she was getting better by the day after her injuries. She blinked looking down the stairs.

"Hey Stiles, what are you doing here?" she asked confused.
"I just came over to bring food since Scott told me there will be a Pack meeting here."
"Oh. Why is that?" She asked confused before she looked over at Derek and Peter and screamed. They all winced as she screamed real loud and Stiles couldn't help but wonder why she was screaming when she was a werewolf. Surely she wouldn't be afraid just like that.

"Who the hell are you?" Cora sniffed the air and her mouth dropped. "Derek, Peter, is that you?" With a burst of werewolf speed she was down the stairs and staring at them in shock.

"Hey sis," Derek said to her stunned face. Her eyes raked over his suddenly quite furry body and her eyebrows rose dramatically at the sight of Derek's sudden expanded gut. She ran her fingers over it in wonder.

"Is this thing real?" She asked in stunned surprise.
"Yeah, for the moment." Derek said. Cora looked over to Peter and she ran over to him too running her hands over his as well.
"You too Uncle Peter?"
"Uh yeah, unfortunately," Peter said uncomfortably.
"That's so cool!" she said excitedly. They all stared at her. "How did you do the hair so fast though?"
"Um, its part of the Awakening Moon and uh say what?" Derek asked stuttering.
"You just look so cute like that, you should keep it. Same for you Uncle Peter. So what's this about an Awakening Moon?"

Well you see," Derek started before sniffing the air. "Whew, Scott is here, I'm getting real tired of explaining this." As soon as he said that, Scott, Issac, Ethan, and Aiden came into the room.
1153321122211.title: Hairy Surprises

choices: "Is anybody as hungry as I am?"
11533211222112.content:
"Whoa...” Stiles said under his breath at the sight of the four werewolves who just entered the room.

Scott, Isaac, Ethan, and Aiden all stood there in skin tight clothing with huge, bloated guts, much like Peter and Derek, but unlike the two male Hale wolves none of them had massive amounts of body hair. Stiles looked around at all of the wolves in the room and mentally started comparing sizes: he could instantly tell that Derek's gut was the biggest, followed by Scott's own huge, bloated belly. After those two were Peter, the twins who had identical guts, and then Isaac, who had the smallest (though it was still big by Stiles' standards).

"I guess the moon got to you four big boys as well?" Peter said in his usual flirtatious voice.
"Yeah," Scott said, thinking back to the night before.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Scott took a deep breath as he stared at the door of the vet's office he worked at. Deaton had already left for the night and Scott still hadn't even attempted to go outside since they found out about the whole Awakening Moon thing. He had already texted Isaac about it, who made the mistake of going outside before hand, and from the texts he got earlier so did Ethan and Aiden who were both currently gorging themselves on massive amounts of food at one of Beacon Hill's buffets. Scott knew he couldn't put this off any longer and pushed the door open, stepping into the moonlight.

Scott felt himself temporarily shift and let out a loud howl before shifting back, gathering his senses the best he could. The very second Scott was in control of his changes he felt and heard a massive growl come from his stomach. Knowing this would happen, based on what he knew about the twin's exposure to the moon, and had already set up plans to meet Isaac at a nearby buffet.

It took maybe 10 minutes for Scott to drive to the buffet and he saw that Isaac was already there when he arrived, having borrowed Scott’s mom’s car. He entered the buffet and grinned to see that the place was totally empty save for a single employee and Isaac who was already scarfing down his 5th plate of food. The ravenous blonde wolf looked up at Scott and grinned, swallowing down the last of his meatloaf, “Scott!” Isaac said, getting up and walking over to the now Alpha wolf and kissing him hard on the lips.

Scott returned the kiss and grinned as he pulled back, “Hey, babe. Wow, you’re really putting it away, huh?” Scott said patting the small bloated belly Isaac was now sporting.

“Yeah but I’m getting kind of full…” he said, rubbing his belly. Without another word the two boyfriends went straight into an eating frenzy. Since it was so empty in the buffet the one employee left said they could eat the remained of the food so they wouldn’t have to throw it all away. Scott and Isaac, now with extra determination to eat on top of the already massive hunger they had went straight to work.

The two wolves ate and ate and ate but there was way more food than they originally thought. After a complete hour of eating Isaac couldn’t do it anymore and he fell back in his booth seat, groaning as he rubbed his enormous beach ball sized gut, which was stuffed, tightly in his fashionable sweater. Scott, on the other hand, wasn’t fazed in the slightest. His stomach was only a tiny bit smaller than Isaacs but Scott wasn’t even beginning to feel the effects of fullness. With his mind obsessed with the idea of eating more food, his own primal instincts taking over, Scott got up and walked over to the huge amount of buffet food left over. The teenage wolf wasted no time even bothering to grab a plate and just started shoveling food into his mouth. His eye glowed red as he scarfed down pound after pound and after another hour of eating the remained of the buffet had been picked clean by Scott.

The teen groaned as he stood up, his massive stomach sticking out almost two feet in front of him and looking like it’s about to pop. Isaac, who was now in less pain, walked over and helped his bloated boyfriend up and the two headed home.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“You guys haven’t shifted the hair away?” Scott asked looking at Peter and Derek. The two looked at each other, not even thinking about that, and did so revealing smooth but bloated bodies.

“So whats this Awakening moon thing?” Cora asked, “I’ve never heard about it.”
“Well..” Scott started and he went on to explain everything about the moon.
“That’s strange…” Cora said, placing her fingers on her chin, “I went out last night and wasn’t affected.”
“It must only work on men.” Isaac said.
“In that case I guess I could stay with Allison or Lydia until this whole thing wears off.” Cora said, heading to her room to pack up.

“That’d be best.” Derek said. As Cora headed off Derek turned to the other bloated wolves and asked…
11533211222112.title: Stuffed Wolves part II (Scott and Isaac)

choices: There is enough after eating all those donuts and poptarts
There isn't and they're still hungry!
115332112221121.content:
"Is anybody as hungry as I am?" Derek asked and when the other wolves nodded, Stiles raised his hand in surprise.

"Seriously, you guys are actually hungry? I can't believe it!" Just at that moment though, Derek's stomach let out a growl as did some of the others. Stiles's eyes widened. "I stand corrected then but I just can't believe it. I mean you guys already ate a ton recently..."

"Stiles, shut up. Did you bring the snacks like I asked you to?" Derek wondered.
"Yeah they're in the car but thinking about it now I probably haven't brought enough..." Stiles gestured helplessly as he looked at the big ravenous wolves around him.

"That's okay, just bring whatever you have in," Derek ordered and Stiles jumped to do so, hoping they weren't thinking of making a meal out of him. They were pretty hungry after all and he'd definitely would prefer not being wolf chow because he was too slow at bringing in snacks.

"Umm, I could use some help..." Stiles started but Derek was already there with him. Muttering under his breath about Derek sneaking up on people, Stiles opened the trunk and Derek immediately picked up six bulging bags of groceries and was (sort of) speed walking back without strain. Stiles noticed two things: how easily Derek carried those and probably could have done more if space had allowed, and his still sexily bloated gut bouncing as he moved. Stiles remembered when Derek had just earlier pushed him against the wall and it had somewhat pushed against him and when he got to poke at it...it sure was different from that infuriatingly ripped six pack hard body. Stiles had liked that too but this...this could be more fun and maybe this whole Awakening Moon thing wouldn't be so bad. Especially if it got bigger which would undoubtedly happen. Stiles felt himself get excited at the thought of Derek getting even bigger, like a real beef-cake wolf with those huge muscles and a big bulging protruding gut...hmm, this wouldn't be so bad after all. Shaking his head, Stiles was about to grab the last couple bags when Derek appeared again and already grabbed them and was walking back in with them at a fast pace.

"Hey, I was bringing those in!" Stiles yelled.
"Yeah, well you were taking too long!" Derek shouted back as he went back in. Running in behind him Stiles could see that the wolves were already going through the bags to see what he brought considering the torn scraps they had left when eagerly ripping open the bags.
"Yeah, you just...go help yourselves." There was a howl of joy from Scott as he pulled out boxes of doughnuts and poptarts.

"You got Donuts and Poptarts? You're the best Stiles!" Ethan, Aiden, and Isaac made noises that might have been agreement as they each took a box and started chomping down like no other. Stiles stood their awkwardly looking around the feeding wolves before going to sit in the corner with the best view of Derek who was eating poptarts. Although the noise was overwhelming, the viewing was fantastic as Derek ate poptart after poptart into that growing gut of his.

"Stiles?" Derek's voice interrupted his wandering thoughts.
"Ahh! I mean hi, what is it?" Stiles asked sweating a little. Derek smirks at him as if knowing what he had been thinking about but he doesn't mention it.

"I know this is a lot to ask since you just brought snacks but maybe you could make some breakfast as well...?" Derek trailed off with a hopeful note in his voice. Stiles winced and sighed before putting on a smile.

"Sure why not? I already brought the snacks which would have at least lasted a week or two before but now only a couple days if that. Man feeding you guys is going to be tough work."

"Sorry about that," Derek said apologetically. "Don't worry about paying for everything, after today me and Peter will probably pay for most of the food except what is eaten on their own."

"Really? How are you guys going to do that?"
"We actually do have quite a bit of family money saved up," Derek said.
"Oh. Well that's good." Stiles awkwardly patted the back of his head not sure what to say.
"The answer is pancakes." Derek declared. Stiles looked at him blankly.
"Huh? What about pancakes?"
"What all of us want. You're going to need to make pancakes." Derek got closer all of a sudden in Stile's space setting his body on high alert.
"Lots of them," Derek whispered in his ear and smirked again at Stile's reaction.
"Fine," Stiles tried to huff out exasperated but came out more breathless and turned on which widened that infernal smirk and for a second Derek's eyes flashed red. Stepping closer, Derek reached out to touch Stiles before Stiles jumped out of the way and headed into the kitchen.

"Pancakes coming right up," Stiles said, hoping to slow down his racing heart. Derek looked sad for a moment before he shrugged and pulled out another poptart and munched on it. Looking out of the kitchen, Stiles could see that Derek was the only one at the moment eating Poptarts which made him the Poptart king which made for a hilarious image of Derek in little to no clothing other than a crown while nibbling daintily, actually more like stuffing down like a hungry wolf, poptarts at high speed. It was just too funny. Still chuckling, he wondered if he could convince Derek to do it while he got the ingredients out of the cupboards to hopefully make enough pancakes to satisfy supernaturally starving werewolves.
115332112221121.title: Stiles the food bringer

choices: Some more food.  I'm still pretty hungry."
1153321122211212.content:
As Stiles stood there, an apron wrapped around his wait, flipping pancake after pancake he slipped the ear buds to his ipod in; since his Dad was sheriff and worked longed night Stiles was accustomed to cooking for himself and making food in large quantities was nothing new to him either. He always made enough of whatever he cooked to last at least a day or two so he wouldn't have to cook every single day. As the 6 bulky werewolves chowed down on two weeks worth of baked breakfast goods Stiles flipped away, making as many pancakes as he possibly could. He found himself shaking his round, cute ass to the beat of the music and soon found himself lost in it.

An hour went by as Stiles cooked, undisturbed, and when he finally ran out of batter he pulled his earbuds out, "Huh... guess I'm out." Stiles looked at the massive amount of pancakes he made and let out a low whistle. He made 6 full stacks; 12 pancakes on each plate and each cake was made with the perfect amount of butter. He turned around and was about to tell everybody they were finished when he was surprised by what he saw. While Peter, Scott, and Derek were sitting back rubbing their's much bigger stomachs Isaac and the twins were lying on the ground groaning slightly by from how stuffed they were.

"Guess they aren't eating.." Stiles said, scratching the back of his head.

It was complete utter agony because while the flavor was delicious, it felt too much and he was trying to not throw up as he much more slowly than before, ate blueberry. Eventually though he finished and he glared hatefully at the last pie which sat there taunting him. It had to be rhubarb didn't it? Although properly cooked it wasn't harmful to werewolves, he still thought it just honestly tasted nasty and he almost threw up at the thought of eating it. It was only the thought of Danny being happy, not to mention the reward, that motivated him to keep going. It took him what felt like an eternity but Ethan actually managed to do it. Danny smirked and made good on what he promised.
11533211222112121212.title: Ethan taste-tests for Danny

115332112221121212121.content:
"Little Red, Little Red, open up Little Red!" Aiden sang as he knocked on the door.
"Oh my god are you serious? Don't do that," Lydia said on the other side.
"Then let me in Little Red," Aiden said grinning. Lydia opened the door, hair still wet from the shower. Aiden grinned wolfishly at her.
"Coming in?" she asked smirking. He smirked as he crossed the entryway.
"Looking good red."
"I always do," Lydia said, actually flipping her hair causing Aiden's eyes to follow. "Anyways, I understand there is a situation going on? Something about some moon effect and werewolf hunger?"

"Um...yeah," Aiden said lamely. Lydia shrugged. "Whatever, I don't mind. I'm actually kind of excited." Aiden stared at her.
"You don't have a problem with this?" He asked.
"Why would I? Its a natural result of supernatural phenomena. Who knows what the rules are? I've just learned to roll with these things around here. After all, I'm a banshee, my friend is a hunter, my other friend is a kitsune, you guys are all werewolves, Jackson was a Kanima, and Stiles is...Stiles."

"Is there a reason you actually said your ex-boyfriend's name?" growled Aiden.
"Jackson? Why does it matter?"
"I don't like it," Aiden said. Lydia smiled as she reached over and touched him.
"Jackson sucks for leaving to London. He hasn't called or texted once during the past couple months. Besides, I'm having fun with you."

"Well that's good," Aiden said relieved. While he would be reluctant to admit it, Lydia had been growing on him and he might be having...feelings?...for her or something. Not as close as Ethan but of the general mill people Lydia had to be the closest. Then Scott sort of but romantic wise maybe Lydia. His brother thought that was hilarious but there was just something about Lydia. Plus, she liked to play and he liked to play and they certainly made wonderful play together.

"So what's the damage? I'm curious," Lydia asked, tugging up Aiden's shirt. Her eyes fixed on his slightly distended stomach. "That's it? I thought it would have been more."

"Well, kind of digested for the most part but I've been one of the least affected. You should have seen Derek, Scott, Peter..." Lydia gave a wide grin.
"Oh thank god Peter. Take that asshole" Aiden looked at her funny. "What? Peter is Peter and the thought of that vain self-loving idiot getting big amuses me."

"What about your friends Scott and Derek?" Lydia frowned.
"Okay true but again, you guys can't help it and we always need to roll with this so uh...I hope they enjoy?" Aiden smirked.
"Heartless."
"Am not," she smacked him and winced. "Oww, stupid werewolf bulk." He grinned at her tauntingly flashing his fangs and then groaned as she ran her hands up his chest. "Wonderful werewolf bulk. You're so much bigger and stronger than Jackson anyhow."

"Well, I guess you could talk about how much better I am than your ex," AIden flexed. Lydia nodded as she felt him.
"Well, you're both cocky douchebag assholes. Fortunately for you that seems to be my type."
"You mean dominant alpha male?" Aiden bragged.
"You mean when you think you're dominating me and I make you my bitch riding you until you beg for mercy? Jackson never did that plus he was a real jerk. Well, you are too but less of one."
"You say the sweetest things," Aiden groaned. Suddenly Lydia removed her hands and he opened his eyes confused. "What?"
"You're going to work for it."
"What do you mean?"
"Pizza." She turned her back and went to the phone, giving AIden a show as she swung her hips.
"What?" He was confused.
"I mean if you guys have to do it, then maybe I want to see. Hey, I'd like an order of um...3?" she turned her head to look back at him and he shrugged, "actually make that 5 extra-large carnivore pizzas with all the meat? Also, two boxes of breadsticks." She gave the address and smiled.

"Is there going to be a party or something?" Aiden asked.
"No silly, that's all for you." Aiden raised his eyebrows.
"While I do have increased appetite and werewolf metabolism, I don't think I'd be able to eat 5 pizzas so you know. You should have done that to Peter though."

"That's actually a good idea, I should do that sometime," Lydia said. Aiden laughed.
"Wow you are cruel."
"Not really but the opportunity to mess with his head like he messed with mine...well, I think it warrants some payback."
"I hope I get to watch. But umm again, I don't think I will actually be able to eat 5 pizzas. Derek or Scott maybe though."
"Shush, only as much as you can handle...and a little bit more."
"Is this really necessary?"
"Yes."

"Okay then," Aiden trailed off. They waited for the order to arrive, Lydia rubbing her hands all over him and telling him exactly what he will get for being a good boy and as good as the playtime was, he was excited to begin so Lydia could get to the good stuff and the door bell couldn't ring fast enough for him. He twitched in anticipation as Lydia opened the doorbell and the strong smell of cheese and meat pizza wafted through the house. He ran his tongue over elongated teeth and he could already feel his face transformed. Unusual since it wasn't directly a full moon but due to the cosmic phenomena it didn't need to be to force out the wolf. When Lydia came back she smirked seeing him salivating. His face might have scared her and it definitely might have if he was going to hurt her, but now that Aiden wasn't with the Alpha Pack and trying to murder her friends and she was sure he probably wouldn't hurt her, how she had no idea but she did, it was kind of adorable. In the supernatural scary monster way. It was a relief not to see red glowing eyes though because she still had nightmares with Peter's as he chased her...

She trailed her fingers through the thick hair that covered his face and chest. "I've never been much into hairy dudes before but you at least persuade me," she murmured. Then she straightened up and grinned. "Besides, I've got pizza! With all the meat toppings that I know you love, being a carnivore and all. He rolled his eyes at her.

"Give it to me now," he snarled, the words distorted by his shifted mouth. The loud growling of his stomach betrayed the hunger that the smell had awakened in him. She set the boxes of pizza in front of him and stepped back as he opened the first one in a blur of speed, the first piece already in his clawed hands and half gone into his mouth. It was a tad terrifying but also interesting to watch Aiden eat, piercing each piece with clawed hands before tearing into it like a wild animal, which he was. It was in almost no time at all before he got through the first box and started on the second. Making growling noises and other sounds that Lydia guessed were enjoyment but was hard to tell, Aiden buried his face into the box and stopped using hands to just use his head. Okay then, he was just tearing into it. Lydia was just glad it wasn't flesh which was all too easy to imagine. Pushing aside the second box, Aiden reached for the third box and Lydia was amazed. It took only 10 minutes, perhaps 15 at the most to eat through those pizzas and they weren't small by any means. Then again, he was a werewolf and probably ate a whole deer in a sittig so maybe it wasn't so surprising. That was just a ton of meat though on those pizzas though. The third pizza went extinct much the same way the first two did and then the fourth. Aiden was finally slowing down and the fevered hungry look was disappearing from his eyes as satiation overtook. His fangs drew back and his ears returned to normal as the fur withdrew and he was back in his human state.

"You know I've always wondered where the hair goes," Lydia said. "Does it just magically disappear or return back inside or what?" Aiden stared at her.
"What?"
"Where does the hair go? I've always wondered."
"I have to say inside sort of. I actually don't know how to describe it. You never asked Scott or Derek?"
"No. Never got the opportunity or kept forgetting. Plus it would be kind of awkward and embarassing."
"You embarassed?" Aiden scoffed. "I don't believe it." He thumped his stomach and let out a loud belch. "Uuuuuuuuuuurrrrrrrrrppppp oh yeah that hit the spot." Lydia deemed it safe so she went behind him and wrapped her fingers around, feeling his stretched stomach that was pushing forward.

"Nice, I can't actually believe you fit all that in there. Well until you went wolf on it. But there is still a bit more room for more." Lydia pushed down bringing another loud burp from Aiden.

"You like this don't you," Aiden asked, leaning agaist her rubbing his stomach.
"Just a little."
"Liar. I smell you lying. You are definitely into this more than just a little." Aiden was a bit surprised but she was.

"Okay, its interesting, seeing you stuff yourself whether in wolf or human form." Lydia admitted. Not that she thought she could lie to a werewolf considering they could sense someone's heartbeat and sniff the perspiration when lying but still, she didn't really quite understand it herself. "Well you do have breadsticks to finish," she teased as she rubbed his rounded bulging stomach. She opened the first box of breadsticks and waved it in front of his nose. His stomach gave a low gurgle and she grinned. "Someone's still hungry."

"Not really, but stop waving it in front of my face and do something with it before I bite your hand." Lydia pushed it into his mouth and he opened obediently as she fed him the breadstick. Then she pulled out the next one and then the next one, feeding each one into Aiden's open mouth. She was impressed because despite complaining, he took each piece and ate it until she reached into the box and couldn't find another. She had fed them all. She was tempted to feed him the last box of pizza but by now Aiden looked stuffed, his poor stuffed stomach pushing heavly against his too tight jeans, abs buried underneath the weight of food he just consumed. Lydia took pity on him and saved it for later.
115332112221121212121.title: Feeding Aiden

115332121221.content:
“You’re tense,” Theo commented beside Scott.

“A little. All these terrible things happening…you’d think there would be an end at some point right?” Scott said, looking out over the school grounds. “What are they doing, turning people into monsters?”

“I don’t know,” Theo replied. “These…Dread Doctors from the book. They’re trying to create a new world or something.” Scott swayed a little on his feet and Theo caught him concerned. “Scott are you okay? What’s wrong?”

“I felt a little woozy there for a second.” Scott mumbled.
“Scott, tell me the truth. Are you okay for real?”
“I…I don’t know. I’ve just been feeling sick for some reason lately and I haven’t been sleeping well.”
“Let’s take you to the Nurse’s office and lie you down.”
“But I’m not sick….” Scott said weakly.
“Yeah, just keep telling yourself that. You’ve been under a lot of strain lately.”
“No, I have to…have to find out what they want. I have to protect the others.”
“You’ve done enough Scott. The pack is fine. You need to take care of yourself at this time.”
“I don’t know. I just feel responsible somehow. They all depend on me and I’ve been doing a terrible job.” Scott tried to sit up, but Theo put his hands on Scott’s stomach and pushed down.

“Stay Scott. The Pack is fine. It is you I’m worrying about. You haven’t been sleeping, it looks like you haven’t eaten in days, and you can barely stand.
“But I have too…”
“But nothing, if you can’t take care of yourself, how can you expect to take care of them?” Theo asked him. Scott let out a hollow laugh.
“That is…that’s actually a really good point,” he muttered, his face flushing.
“I know. Now let’s go and get you something to eat before you pass out. And don’t you dare so you’re not hungry or I might have to smack some sense into you.”
“Okay Theo…” Scott sighed. “Thanks a lot.”

“It’s my pleasure,” Theo said. “Now we have to get you better.” Letting Scott lean on him, Theo helped Scott to his car. “In fact, don’t even worry about the nurse or school, I’ll just take you home. They’ll understand.” After Scott buckled the seatbelt of Theo’s car, in the passenger side, Theo trotted off to the nurse’s office to tell of the situation. Scott’s mind wandered for a bit and he was started when Theo was back and tapping on the windows.

“Sorry, just checking on you. Let’s go.” Theo got in and began driving. “I guess you can stay at my house for a bit. My parents are out but I’m sure they won’t mind if you stay for a little bit.” There was silence for the rest of the drive which Scott didn’t mind because he was having a massive headache. Theo helped him out of the car and into the rather long driveway of a massive house.

“You actually live here?” Scott said amazed.
“Yep. Home sweet home.” Theo input the keycode and the gate went up. “Now come on, let’s get you inside.” Theo led Scott inside and Scott frowned at his dirty shoes and clothes, afraid to touch and get the slightest dirt on anything.

“Here, get on the couch and lie down. I’ve got some soup and cookies for you.” Scott protested but after Theo helped him take off his shoes and moved him to the couch, Scott fell silent and couldn’t help but stretch out and relax on the luxurious sofa. He didn’t know couches could come this soft. Theo was soon back and placing a very large plate of cookies and a cauldron of sop down on the table in front of the couch.

“Are those wolf shaped cookies?” Scott asked amused and Theo smiled.
“Yeah, I couldn’t help myself. Since we’re werewolves you know.”
“What is with the white stuff?”
“Oh, you know, wolves in sheep's clothing. I like puns and tricks.”
“So is this a trick?” Scott asked.

“No, this is not a trick,” Theo said looking into Scott’s eyes. “I really am glad you’re here and I want to take care of you. I want to make you feel better. You do so much for other people that it has been taking a toll on you. Let other people help you the way you help them. I want to help you.”

“You’re not going to take no for an answer are you?” Scott asked looking at him.
“Nope,” Theo told him, popping his mouth at the o sound.
“Very well then.” Scott said. “Then I accept.”
“Smart boy,” Theo laughed. “Now let’s get some food in you before you collapse or faint.” He picked up a cookie. “Want me to feed this to you?” He asked slyly.
“No I’m good, thanks. I can feed myself right now. But thank you very much for the food.”

“It’s my pleasure.” Theo smiled. “Tell me what you think about them okay?” Scott nodded and then took a bite. Scott’s face widened in surprise and Theo smirked a little seeing the look on Scott’s face. “They’re good huh?” Theo asked, his lips curled up in a pleased expression.

“Yeah they’re good,” Scott said. “These might be the best damn tasting cookies I’ve ever tasted.”
“I’m glad you like them so much. I’ve spent a long time working on them for you.” Theo said.
“Huh?”
“Of course, I didn’t know you were going to be nearly passing out a couple of times from stress and not eating enough but I am glad you enjoy them. What did you eat yesterday?” Theo asked Scott. Scott mumbled something garbled and even with super hearing, it sounded garbled to Theo.

“What was that?”
"Some toast, orange juice, a couple slices of pizza …that’s about it.” Theo shook his head.
“Is that all day? That’s barely enough for a human your age, let alone with a werewolf metabolism. No wonder you’re beginning to fall apart.” Theo tsked, shaking his head. "You need to eat more. That is not healthy.”

“I’m fine…” Scott started and Theo pointedly stared at him.

“You’re fine? You call that fine? You almost passed out and have been drifting in and out of consciousness at school and the ride here. How do you expect to survive a Dread Doctor, or even regular supernatural attack in the state you’re in?”

“I don’t know, I’ll find a way…” Scott said attempting to get up and Theo bodily shoved him back down.

“No, no, and no. If I have to smack some sense into you, I will. You’re not well enough and I don’t like seeing you suffer. You’re too…good for that.” Theo frowned. “I care about you.”

“Theo…” Scott started.
“Scott, eat the damn cookies and soup.” Theo snapped.

“Okay, thanks.” Scott said as he sat back down into the couch. He picked up another cookie and ate it, groaning a little. It really did taste fantastic. Looking at Theo, he saw Theo wink and nod at him encouragingly so Scott picked up another, and another. His blood sugar levels must have been low because he really was feeling better after each and every cookie and less that he was about to collapse. Theo was right about him not eating enough. After a dozen or so cookies, Scott slowed down, licking his lips clean of the white frosting. He wasn’t sure why Theo decided to make Wolves-In-Sheep’s-Clothing cookies but they tasted really good. Looking over, he saw Theo just looking at him and smiling encouragingly. He tilted his head and gave a nod towards the remainder of the plate of cookies and the giant serving of soup was. Clearly Scott was supposed to finish the whole thing. Scott didn’t know why as he was feeling a little full from the cookies but Theo wanted him to finish. If Theo would feel better about Scott eating this stuff, then he was going to eat all this stuff. Shifting positions, Scott straightened and reached for another cookie and bit into it, giving little whimpers of delight from the burst of sugary goodness.

Soon all 24 cookies were gone and the plate licked clean of crumbs and frosting. Giving a little burp Scott stretched his arms and body back. Theo’s eyes darted to the flash of skin and he found himself smiling at the sight of the little bump of Scott’s belly filled with his treats. Scott looked good and happy and not skeletal. Now Scott just had to keep going. He eagerly watched as Scott took a spoonful of chicken noodle soup and sipped at it.

“How is it? Is it a good temperature? It’s not too hot is it?” Theo asked worriedly. He wanted it to taste good to Scott.
“It’s fine Theo,” Scott smiled. “Actually, it’s perfect, just like those cookies which were so good by the way.”
"I’m glad to hear that,” Theo said relieved. “I don’t want you to burn your mouth.”

“Don’t worry, I’ll be fine. I could handle hot soup. I mean, we’re werewolves after all. But it really is at the perfect temperature at the moment now that it has cooled a little."

"I'm glad to hear that. You're feeling better right?"

"Yeah, in fact I feel pretty stuffed," Scott said, rubbing his stomach. Theo's eyes followed the path Scott's fingers made on the taut skin.
"Yeah, it looks good. It's much better than hungry or starving I say," Theo said smiling at Scott.
"I guess," Scott said, pushing down and giving a satisfied burp and yawn. "I'm feeling kind of tired."
"Lay back and rest Scott," Theo said, coming over and kneeling in the space between the couch and the table. "Let me take care of you. You deserve to be cared for."
115332121221.title: An unwell Scott

11533222222222222222111.content:
"This is the life" Booth said chilling in his bathtub with his drinking hat on.

It had been a few months since any corpses have showed up and work had been slow so it had given Booth plently of time to get R&R. He had been spending his time either at the diner or the gym, he had to keep in shape of course. As Booth got out of the tub he noticed that his belly seemed to be a little rounder than usual.
