142112211111111111111111.content:
Meanwhile in the Batcave, the containment cells of Ivy, Harley, and Peyton were active. Harley got angry and was yelling and demanding from someone to release her. Ivy tried to relax with the plants in her cell and the small water feature. Her radio had the soothing sound of the rainforest. Peyton was watching her T.V. to tune out the yelling of Harley. She noticed that there nobody else in cave tunnel consisting of the cells. She noticed movement in the shadows and saw Nightwing emerge from the darkness. She caught loudly and that alerted the other two villainess to stop what they’re doing and be aware of Nightwing.

“Breakfast ladies. Hope you enjoy it “said Nightwing as he came up to a wall and pushed a button. A hole at the top of each cell opened and out fell a meal for each villainess. Peyton got a stack of pancakes with a side of bacon with fruit and some coffee. Ivy got a vegetarian egg scramble with tofu and an organic apple with a large cup of water. Harley got a stack of waffles with a side of sausage and coffee.

“Where are we? The does not seem to be any jailhouse known to house Gotham’s villains. “said Peyton as she sipped on her coffee Ivy watched silently while Harley dug into her food with gusto.

“Your right as this a special jailcell to contain you three. Batman designed it to contain you three as there are very few places that contain you three. Ivy with her powers, Harley with her manipulation, and you Peyton with your seduction. “said Nightwing as he stepped back and started to walk into the shadows. He stopped and turned around and said. “Enjoy your time here and with each other, you could have been in Arkham, if the Joker had not destroyed it and rumors are that some government officials want to villains to be a special task group to for the government doing its dirty work. They put small bombs in the heads of villains and if they step out offline then the bomb goes off. I heard Killer Croc was drafted and he has to work for the government or it off with his head.” Nightwing smirked and walked into the shadow only to be swallowed up the darkness.

“Of course, its Joker’s fault. It is always Joker’s fault when villains must pay for his crimes. We could have been in Arkham, instead of going to other jailhouse that can contain villains and metahumans. “Peyton murmured in a low voice as she has heard stories of what goes on in the jailhouse that house villains. Beatings, abuse and other horrors as many of the prison guards look the way if a villain is beaten by the guards. Arkham has at least staff that are watched closely to make sure that they don’t abuse their position or power against a patient in Arkham.

“Hey take that back. Pudding was just trying to maintain his position as the most unpredictable villain in Gotham. “said Harley trying to defend her love. Nobody understood their love that was special to them. There were just jealous that they did not have a special person in their life so they tried to destroy Harley and Joker’s relationship.

“Harley why do you even defend him. He abuses you, multiple times. Leave him before you lose your life to that crazy clown. You are just a tool and loyal to him. Once lose your usefulness if is going to get rid of you. “said Ivy from her cell. While Catwoman and Harley are close friends to Ivy. Ivy and Catwoman have both grown tired and annoyed at Harley’ romantic love for the Joker.

‘You’re wrong. He loves me and is going to free me ounce he formulates a plan to free from Batman. “said Harley in a believing voice. Harley’s eyes started to water after the hurtful accusation that Ivy said to her.

“Harley! He threw you out a window several stories high. He strapped you to a rocket and when he told you that you are a distraction to his goals. When you are in Arkham he hired a replacement for your position. You’re a tool and loyal one at that. When you lose your usefulness, he will get rid of you. I heard through the grapevine that the other villains are getting tired of his crimes as it often hurts other villains plans or get the Batman on their trail. They want to hunt down the clown and end his annoying crimes for good. “said Ivy as she heard rumors the villains in Gotham want to eliminate the clown prince of crime. She also remembers all the Harley told her the awful things that Joker has done to her during their girl bonding times. Both were drunk, but Ivy remember it all as alcohol does not impact as much as a regular human due to her powers.

“Harley, your obsession blinds you towards the harsh reality of Joker’s use of you.” said Ivy know that the cold harsh facts could break Haley’s relationship with the Joker. Harley went and curled up in a ball on the bed and tried to think about all the time she and the Joker expressed their love. Ivy felt a bit sad after seeing Harley, but she knew it was the right things to say to her. Ivy went back to eating her food and interact with the plants. The plants were raised perfectly and Ivy’s option on whoever raised them skyrocketed. Her view of being locked up in another cell is better than being at Arkham as it full of vile people who try to flirt with her or don’t care about her plants. In Arkham she would be watched when she would be allowed to interact with the plants.

“How Harley is loyal to the Joker is beyond me. “said Peyton as she started to eat her breakfast. The food was very good as it was better then what Peyton as most of the time. she would often eat meals prepared by some of the best cooks in the world, due to her wealth she could afford to pay them. She shortly finished eating her meal and turned on the T.V. to watch some movie.
142112211111111111111111.title: Meanwhile with Ivy,Harley, and Peyton.

1421122111111111111111111.content:
The women got up and left the dining room going down a long corridor and saw Alfred dusting a series of large painting of men and women. Alfred noticed them and greeted them with a smile.

“Alfred, you look well. I feared that with the rise in magical activity in Gotham would put some stress on the Batfamily.” said Zatanna with a small smile on her face.

“Why thank you Zatanna. Master Bruce have handled the rise of magical activity well and he has the help of the other members of the Batfamily to help him. He also has called in other magical heroes like you, but under his tight strict watch. “said Alfred as stopped his dusting as he spoke and went back at dusting after he finished speaking.

“How do you handle clean this giant manor?” asked Dinah with curiosity. Green Arrow’s manor is large, but compared to Bruce’s manor, it is like comparing a lake to an ocean. Oliver’s manor is nice, but a bit tacky with pictures of him. Bruce’s manor is larger and tasteful furnished with manicured lawns and gardens.

“Well, Bruce has given some chores to his Batfamily and he has constructed robots to help with the more difficult and harder tasks. I oversee them as they also act as sensors to make sure that there is no uninvited personal in the manor or property. For example, I am dusting the portraits of Bruce’s ancestors on both sides of his family. The robots are cleaning and maintain other areas in and around the manor. You may see them hovering around. “said Alfred pointed to the portraits who show that they were recently dusted.

The group of women noticed that the series of portraits of men and women showed the years of Bruce’s family throughout the centuries in Gotham and before coming to Gotham. They also noticed several of the women in the portraits looked like the very like the viewers. The men in the pictures were a mix of being fat or muscular or both. Both men and women the portraits looked happy, regal and in love with each other.

The women split up to think about how to counter the situation from what Bruce’s portfolios contained. Diana, Selina, Tora, Beatriz and Kimiyo went outside to the pool to think and soak up the sun. Talia, Dinah, and Zatanna walked around for a bit and found themselves in a vast well stocked library. Andrea found a path that led into the Batcave to try to talk and reignite the love between Her and Bruce.

Diana, Selina, Tora, Beatriz, and Kimiyo walked around the large pool outside the manor soaking up the sunlight. For them it is nice to get out of the gloomy city known as Gotham. They all stood in thought about their problems and soon Diana suggest they talk to each other as they may help each woman with a piece of advice. They all agreed to start trusting each and put aside their problems with each other as infighting will hinder their effectiveness. They all talk about each of their situation and together came up with a good plan on how to counter each other villains. Diana suggest that they also help each other out as the help heroines can be unknown advantage that can surprise the villains. Diana helped oversee each counter plan thanks to Athena’s blessings giving Diana a mind of a great tactician.

Talia, Dinah, and Zatanna all walked around the vast library and thought on how to counter their enemies. Zatanna thought perhaps Dinah could help her with her problem and maybe vice versa with Dinah problem. She soon bumped into Talia and inwardly decided to put her past problems aside and act helpful towards the skilled assassin. She also noticed that Dinah stumbled onto them. They talked civilized and Talia needs Dinah’s martial arts skills to help repeal the leagues’ enemies and Zatanna’s occult knowledge to help decode arcane writing that the Court of Owls and the Council of Spiders used. The women decided to help each other with each other problem while putting their difficulties aside to start to trust each other to solve their problems.

While the women thought about how to tackle their problem, Andrea was trying to find Bruce in the Batcave. She walked towards the Batcomputer and saw Bruce hard at work on a recent mystery case. She also saw Damian fighting against training robots while Dick and Tim watched from nearby monitoring his progress. As she walked towards him silently. She saw Bruce stop and tense up as he if he could feel her presence near him. She saw him turning away from his work towards her facing her.

“Hello Bruce. It is nice to see you again. I hope we can still be close friends. “said Andrea unsure on how her former lover might react. She hoped it would not be too bad.

“Andrea. I thought you left Gotham after the Joker incident. I heard you were living in Europe. Why return here? “asked Bruce in a cold voice. Andrea’s presence started to bring up old love feeling. He wanted Andrea dark drive for revenge and move on from it, but it consumed her too much and she left with a piece of Bruce’s heart.

Andrea told Bruce on what lead her to Gotham and Bruce did a quick check on the Batcomputer to verify the artifacts history with Andrea family. It turned out to be correct and both went back to talking. They continued to exchange small talk for several minutes until Andrea got fed up ask her question.

“Can we pick up from where we left off before the whole Joker situation. I still have feeling for you?” asked Andrea as she has hope that she would still love him.

“You hurt me deeply. “Bruce responded and less cold voice then before.

“I know that what I did was unforgettable, but I could not let my family be hurt by these criminals and that after I left Gotham I started to move past it and not let it hold me back. I hope we can still have a relationship in the future.” Said Andrea as she had some lingering regrets of what she did, but she has moved past that. Leaving Gotham hurt her as she left her lover and a large part of her behind.

“I will forgive, but it will take time to regain my trust and affection. I thought long and hard about what you did and I can relate to what you did to the Joker. “said Bruce as he recalled Alfred giving him a talk about his parents would make up after a fight and it tests that made their love for each other grow stronger.

“Thank you. I hope to regain your trust and love again. “said Andrea as she felt hope rise in her with purpose of regaining Bruce’s’ love and trust. She gave Bruce a smile and told him that she would be back in the manor if he needs her. She turned and left the Batcave via an elevator.
1421122111111111111111111.title: With the other women.

14211221111111111111111111.content:
Bruce heard footsteps behind him and instantly recognized who these who is behind him. He swerved his chair and saw his guests wanting to speak with him.

“You made your plans to help with your situations already? “asked Bruce with a raised eyebrow.

The superheroines nodded and felt a light blush as they saw how handsome Bruce is by the computer light.

“Yes, we did, but on the way down during the elevator ride, Diana help create a great plan to defeat each of our situation’s villains. She reasoned that we all help each other as each heroine and villains adds new elements to the plans. Other women started to voice that they too had otherworldly encounters and their blessings given to them by these divine beings, and them fated soulmate.

“Well last night, my gods came to me and gave be a blessing to enhance my powers and they supported me, they also told me that I am connect to a loving man and my soulmate. “said Diana and she smiled at Bruce who felt a twinge of love at the amazon princess, but calmed his facial features to express a calm and collect man.

“I have lots of books on supernatural entities and I did experience a divine encounter. Let me cast a spell a to reveal this soulmate bond. “said Zatanna. She summoned her magic and her eyes glowed an ethereal purple for a few seconds and stopped.

“The spell to revealed to me that each of us had a divine encounter and that includes three ladies that Bruce locked up in their prison cells. The spell also reveals that our bond is connect to Bruce and that also the ladies locked up are also connected to Bruce. “said Zatanna.

“Is there a way to break this bound? I love Bruce, but I feel that this bound is forced. “said Selina as she sauntered and put her arms around Bruce’s large powerful muscular arms and chest. She could feel how strong and thick with power his muscles gave off. While she did this each woman felt a spark of jealousy as they wanted to feel Bruce’s physique.

“Sorry Selina, but if divine beings can’t break that bond then I doubt even my magic or other magical superheroes could break that bound. Perhaps the Spector and the Phantom Stranger could together try to break the bond, but I feel that a higher force would order them not to. “Zatanna as she and Selina fixed their relationship after Gotham Sirens incident.

“I suggest that we talk about this problem later. I could get some research about this bond and ask my gods on why they can’t they break it.” said Diana as she besides Zatanna have the most experience with the supernatural world.

“Perhaps we can talk about it later after we research more about this bond. “said Talia as she knew that the occult can be very tricky. She and her father have used the occult in the past, and often it would backfire on the demon head and his assassin daughter. Her father has respect for the supernatural, but is very cautious around it. He rarely works with supernatural villains as their magic is often unstable.

“Bruce what are look at?” said Beatriz as she looked at the computer screen on the Bat computer. The screen displayed various crimes scenes and disappearances of people. Her training as an investigator kicked as she tried to make connection with all the information on the computer screen. She did train under Bruce and her training did make her one of the top female investigator in the superhero community.

“I am investigating a string of disappearances. All the victims are young rising stars in the culinary world. Most of them are bakers or candy makers or ice cream makers. At the crimes scenes, that is no evidence of a forced break in and no money theft was reported. All the victims were last seen by their coworkers as that they stayed behind at their respective business to close for the night. It is if that disappeared into thin air. I scanned for any usual energy residue or any out of the ordinary. Nothing. Even the surveillance cameras recorded nothing as they were offline during these abductions. “said Bruce as he pulled up files with names, information, pictures of the victims and their crime scenes.

“I heard about this people disappearing. Most of them won money on those baking competitions shows and they set up shop in rough neighborhoods. I also heard that some of their shops were destroyed between the ongoing feuds between Gotham’s supervillains, like some being set on fire by Firefly, getting gassed by Scarecrow or being smashed by Bane. “said Selina as she read it in the newspaper or saw it on the news and through her criminal contacts. Selina herself was confused as all the villains she knows about in Gotham, none of them have a hatred against the bakers and their shops.

“I think I have an idea of what is going on with these people disappearing. Due to recent spike in magical activity in Gotham. There is a thriving black market on magic and mystical objects. Doctor Fate and the Spector have been banishing the big players in this black market, but there have been shipments of powerful magical objects that got lost and scattered throughout Gotham. With black market going into panic mode the venders to hide among the populations here. “said Zatanna as she heard from other magical heroes had a hard time of reducing the magical activity here in Gotham. She consulted Madam Xanadu and she told her that Gotham is a beacon of magic and that it attracts the supernatural to that city making it a haven for the otherworldly, but Gotham has this anomaly that twist any magical being in the city towards mental instability.

"It is possible that there is a person who may have unleashed a powerful magical artifact or the less likely chance there is a new villain in Gotham. " said Diana as she inspected the clues on the Bat computer's screen.

Just then the group heard a growl and became on alert. Talia saw not movement and saw Bruce put a hand on his stomach. She raised an eyebrow. The women saw a rare moment when a small shade of blush of embarrassment came and went on Bruce face. Zatanna then saw two tiny little holes on Bruce’s neck.

“Bruce are those the bite marks of a vampire?” asked Zatanna as she know from some of her supernatural contacts that vampires avoid Gotham as they feel that there is darkness that they love, but it is tainted and twisted. There was also a rumor that a witch fell in love with a vampire, but the vampire left her and she cursed the city so that vampires can never enter city.

Bruce opened his mouth to respond, but the group heard a voice coming from…

After years of being worshiped by all who practiced sumo Terrashima decided to restore balance in the universe starting with earth. He had decided in order to bring balance he will have the greatest heroes and villains compete in a contest. The winning side will then be able to guide earth into the alignment of their choosing. In this way the world will be completely balanced. As Batman was about to capture the Joker they are both captured by a strange light.

"What kind of trick is this Joker!" Batman yelled.

"Who are you?" asked Superman.

"I am Terrashima the Bringer of Balance. For centuries I have watched this world shift from good to evil without any proper balance. I have decided to gather the greatest heroes and villains to determine the fate of your world. You will compete in the ancient sport of Sumo wrestling to determine whether good or evil takes control of Earth. You have one year before the Grand Tournament of Earth. I expect to see a good show." Maybe you will find out for yourself, but they make you bigger"

He walked into his class, but when he wanted to sit down at his table his butt started to grow! A soft rip could be heard when his butt started to push his pants to the limit.

His classmates started to look at Clark, but he tried to ignore it. He doesn't like this attention.

A loud RIP could be heard and when Clark looked down he saw that his pecs started to push out and stretched his shirt. Holes started to form and his pecs started to grow out of his shirt.

He had to get away, now!

1423122.title: Damian Wayne

14231222.content:
Hello, my name is Damian Wayne, the Boy Wonder, Grandson of the Demon's Head, Heir to the Cowl, & the only blood-son of Batman & Talia Al Ghul. We've had a relatively quiet week here in Gotham, even at night when criminal elements should be taking advantage of our weakness. Regardless, with times this quiet & uneventful, I've been thinking about my well, feelings about other people in my life. I know what you're thinking, "What Damian Wayne thinking about other people or his feelings? What is this world coming to?"

Well I don't need anyone commenting on this but the point is that talking about other people or my feelings is very, difficult for me. I was raised to be a leader first, and an assassin second by my grandfather's cult, the League of Assassins, so what I was thinking was completely out-of-character from what I've been taught. Here is where my troubles began. I was coming home from patrol with Grayson as Batman, when we hit a speed bump. As we were about to go over it towards one of the many entrances to the Batcave, the speed bump somehow grabbed the bottom of the Batmobile & suspended it 20 ft. in the air over the street. I hit my head hard even though I was wearing my seatbelt & tried to reach my sword. As Grayson tried to activate the weapons system & prepare for a battle, the assailant was discovered to be a series of vines & roots that were smothering the car & ripping out the tires. This could be the work of only one villainess, Poison Ivy.

"Welcome to the Jungle Batman & Robin" Poison Ivy declared with menace while she was glowing in the aura of her victory, and the radiance of glowing moss which she was wearing like makeup. The glowing moss's scents seemed to permeate the car's ventilation system. Damian knew something was wrong, Ivy may be a violent criminally insane metahuman, but she usually plays out her attacks with more subtlety, & grace. This time she's gone bat shit crazier than usual & was illuminating the city with her prehistoric super plants & it looked like her weapons & army were built to last a 1,000 years. To top it off, all of the super plants had a strange glowing moss oozing near the base of the stem like blood from an open wound.

"You seem stronger ivy, but a direct assault isn't usually your thing. What's your plan this time?" Dick inquired in his best Batman impression, as he cautiously put his hand near the trigger of a non-lethal cannon.

"Oh I see somebody's being a smarty pants. Well to put it simply, I needed you out of the way so I could reclaim Gotham, & before you use any of your bat-gadgets in that super fast car of yours, I have an ace up my sleeve." Ivy waved her hand, and coming out of a conjured plant pod was Batgirl, or at least what looked like Batgirl. The current Batgirl is Cassandra Cain, and It seems that Ivy has enthralled Cassandra to her side, bu there was one problem, there was no utility belt. I sighed in relief, it appears that Ivy created a plant-based clone of Batgirl with almost everything, except a copy of her utility belt. You remember Batgirl don't you boys, because I made sure she remembers you. & before you say 'That can't be Batgirl. Where's her utility belt?' Well this isn't the original batgirl but she has her real D.N.A., life-force, & her utility right here". This here is the real batgirl's tool belt, & it will work with my clone's D.N.A. Plus if you try to destroy my army of Batgirls, they psychic backlash will kill the real Batgirl, whose secrets will be revealed to the world. So I'm leaving you with an ultimatum, relinquish yourselves to me right now, & I will be merciful, only doing what I've done to your bat-brat, to everyone else. If you don't surrender, or try anything remotely sneaky, then I'll have the entire city blanketed in toxins of which there will be no curing, as well as end Batgirl's life & reveal her secrets to the world. So what will it be Batman? Your sidekick & the city, for the world, you have until dawn to decide what to do. Goodbye Batman, I hope you make the right choice." Ivy concluded her monologue, then jumped off onto another flower that seemed to radiate a rainforest vibe.

Things were already looking bleak, but as I stared dumbfounded at Ivy's threat, Grayson analyzed everything, the clone of Batgirl, as well as the army had been infused with her life-force, & it turns out that Ivy wasn't kidding. The clones had similar enough D.N.A. in order to fool the biometric scanners on the utility belt, the copy of the utility belt that the prime clone used was the real deal, & Cassandra is still unaccounted for as of a few days ago on a mission to Guatemala. This meant if we kill the clones, Cassandra will die, & her secrets, or rather ours, would be exposed. But before we could do anything else, we glowing moss created nasty smelling tendrils which wrapped themselves around me & yanked my body out of the car & into a plant pod which was burrowing itself underground. I tried to scream, but I was gagged by leaves emitted a sickly sweet scent of incense which put mmy mind in a daze.

"Robin no!!!!" Grayson screamed as he too was dragged underground. Despite the terror I felt, i was strangely relaxed, & I heard two new voices calling out to us, voices that Grayson seemed to recognize. I tried to squint closer at him, but all I got was him mouthing "Not Ivy". The next thing I knew everything went black... Who do Batman & Robin meet next since it's not ivy pulling them underground

1423321.title: Killer Croc

choices: Everything was there, just like Chase said it was
14233212.content:
Sirens roared in the distance, as crime erupted in every dark corner of this rotten cesspool of a city. Just another night in Gotham...

Amidst the nonstop madness, a raven haired eighteen year old runs for dear life as a ravenous pair of thugs chase him down the mean streets of the Bowery. "Come on! We just wanna talk!" laughed one of the almost deranged thugs as he and his partner picked up speed. Chase, the teenager in question, caught on and sprinted as hard as he possibly could. His athletic build was made doubly apparent as he gained speed and managed to break the line of sight between his pursuers.

The two crazed criminals tore through the alley, searching high and low as Chase fearfully hid behind a dumpster, praying to whatever God was listening that he'd survive the night. One of them laughed maniacally and hollered, "C'mon, little lady! Don'tcha know it's rude to steal things that don't belong to ya?! Now come on out and face your punishment like a man!" Chase's heart was beating faster than ever when the lunatic decided; just for fun, to add, "come out now, and we might even let you live!"

His heart was on the verge of exploding in his chest when the sound of footsteps in the distance grew nearer to his dumpster. He was dead. He knew it. They'd find him and do God only knows what to him when they did...

...But as luck would have it, there was a manhole just past the dumpster. Not his first option, but if it got him away from the psychopaths pursuing him, then who was he to complain?

Checking carefully to ensure neither one was nearby, young Chase quietly slid the manhole cover open and entered the sewer, closing the lid above him as he descended deeper and deeper into the damp, putrid abyss beneath Gotham City.

"Ergh, nnngg oh my God....that smell..." Chase complained, covering his nose as he stepped on the concrete walkway, avoiding the raw sewage just nearby, stepping as far away from the manhole as possible, hoping to uncover a separate manhole ladder to another block, far away from the madmen.

As Chase walked down the walkway, another more horrifying thought crept into his mind, as he recollected the urban legends he'd heard over the last few years. Of a terrible creature lurking beneath Gotham. A beast of immeasurable power, and a ravenous appetite for flesh...the Killer Croc...

No one truly knows how this beast man came to be, or what made him the way he was, but besides a few crazed sightings and folk tale, no one had ever seen the beast. Or at least, seen him...and lived...

"Just some crazy rumors, that's all!" Chase told himself, as he laughed nervously. "I mean come on, a giant man-eating crocodile man?"

Then, a cold, booming laughter stopped Chase mid sentence. "Yeah...wouldn't that just be crazy...?" echoed a deep, growling voice, closer than Chase wanted to admit. Frozen stiff with fear, Chase; despite every fiber against his better judgement, slowly turned his head around to confirm his fears. And as his face went white, his fears were confirmed...

Lumbering over him, stood a terror at least nine feet tall...

The creature was immense. In place of skin, was nothing but green scales from head to toe, and white scales over the beasts pecs and belly. His body was thick with muscle. He wore only a raggedy pair of filthy pants, and as his yellow eyes pierced down at tiny Chase, his salivating, razor sharp teeth bared out for Chase to see and know...that this monstrosity was none other, than Killer Croc...

Chase couldn't move. It was too unreal, too terrifying. His lower lip trembled as he tried to call for help, but was simply too petrified to even whimper. Getting a big whiff of the teenagers terror, Croc grinned toothily and said, "So...just what's a tasty morsel like yourself, doing in my neck of the woods, hmm?"

He couldn't answer. Those horrible, hungry eyes pierced right into Chase's soul, letting him know exactly how sealed his fate was. Nevertheless, Chase mustered what little courage he had left in him and said, "Well....mister Croc, sir, I'm...lost..."

Croc snarled in agreement. "You certainly are..." he replied, licking his scaly lips. As if things weren't bad enough, a loud rumbling echoed throughout the sewers. Chase looked up, knowing exactly where the source lied. Croc snickered sickly as he rubbed his hungry stomach and replied, "Good thing you happened to stumble upon my lair...I haven't eaten in quite a while..."

"Wait!" Chase blurted out, nearly on the verge of crying. "Please d-don't do it! I-I..." His train of thought was stumped as he tried to talk his way out of a grim situation. Suddenly, an idea emerged.

"These two guys, see, they chased me! Forced me down here!" Croc snarled with disinterest, but Chase continued anyway, "They wanted to kill me, because there's a warehouse! Not far from here! And I...kinda tried to steal what was inside."

A moment passed, before Croc inquired, "What was inside?" As if to foreshadow his answer, Chase's own stomach roared hungrily, catching Croc's attention. "Food. Tons of it. These guys just knocked off a grocery shipping truck, stuffed with an entire shipment of all kinds of food, snacks, meat, drinks, the whole nine yards! I guess they were probably gonna sell it off, or send it for their whole gang." Croc's intimidating stance eased slightly as he folded his arms and looked down at the teenager with some mild interest.

However, as he pondered, his own stomach reminded him that he was still incredibly hungry, but Chase caught on and interjected with, "You really think I'm gonna satisfy your hunger? Look at me! I'm nothing but skin and bones!" Obviously, Chase was exaggerating. He was slim, but rather toned and athletically built for a young man of his size. "And think about it! All that food just there for the taking? That'll fill you up well past the day! And you don't have to hunt it or wait for it to come to you! Cause it's all just right there in that warehouse!"

"Where is this warehouse?" Croc demanded. "Nearby," Chase reluctantly replied. "Where specifically?" Croc retorted, a bit impatiently, which made Chase nervous, but he did his best to keep his cool, remembering what was at stake, as he said, "If I tell you, there's nothing to stop you from just eating me and going to the warehouse." Croc growled angrily, as if to remind Chase who he was talking to, but Chase continued. "I can take you to the warehouse, and I can show you exactly where they're hiding the stolen truck! All I ask, is that you don't...eat me. Deal?"

This was a new one alright...

Killer Croc was used to hearing his food beg for their lives, but never before had he ever heard a deal that was as tempting as this one. And it's not like eating Chase would sate his hunger. It could be days or weeks before another helpless soul decided to crawl down into his sewers, and with GCPD under new management, and the dreaded Batman ruling over the surface, hunting his own food could have been harder than he realized. So, against his immediate wishes, Croc grunted in annoyance and muttered, "Deal." He then looked down more fiercely at Chase and said, "But you BETTER find the warehouse, and it BETTER still have food inside...or I'll pick my teeth with your bones! Got it?"

Yet again, Chase went white, nodding ever so slightly, acknowledging Croc's demands. "Good. Now, get a move on!" Chase wasted no time climbing back up to the surface. He had been so terrified that he'd practically forgotten the whole reason he was even down in the sewers. Luckily, those psychotic criminals were nowhere to be seen. Croc, despite his better judgement, was too hungry to swim to shore and back, so he punched the manhole open and made more than enough room for him to emerge up to the surface.

Chase led Croc back to the very warehouse that got Chase into this mess to begin with, unimpeded by any gang members this time. Croc tore the door open as both he and Chase entered the warehouse.

Inside were at least ten different trucks, each one covered by dusty tarps. Croc looked around and turned to Chase. "Now, make with the food, or else, you know what..." Chase gulped nervously, and approached the grocery truck...
14233212.title: From the sewers, dwells the hungry Killer Croc

choices: Chase finishes and is already full.
Chase finishes and continues to eat alongside Croc.
142332121.content:
"Oh thank you, sweet, merciful God..." Chase said as he wiped the sweat from his forehead. With a smile of relief, he pulled the back door of the truck up and then stepped aside for the large Croc man to investigate personally. Immediately, the scent of non-spoiled goods filled Croc's highly sensitive nose. As if acting on reflex, he licked his scaly lips, and bared his razor sharp teeth happily as he stepped towards the back of the truck, and proceeded to grab whatever he could fit in his large, muscular arms, which; suffice to say, was a lot.

Pulling out various meats, boxes of snacks, drinks, and virtually anything that resembled food, Croc glanced down at his appetizer to be, salivating. He still preferred the taste of terrified, sewer dwellers over anything else, but it had been so long since he'd eaten anything besides rats, and the occasional poor soul, that he'd almost forgotten what real people food tasted like. Grabbing one of the rotisserie chickens, he pulled the plastic top off and opened his mouth nice and wide, swallowing the chicken whole. Chase watched the large beast extend his jaws a bit as he took several ample gulps to work the chicken into his mouth. Within an instant, Croc slammed his jaws shut, and chewed the entire chicken viciously, savoring the long since forgotten taste. "Mmm, juicy," Croc muttered, mouth still full of chicken, before he took a thick gulp.

Chase watched, mystified, as the ample mouthful of chicken meat...and bones...traveled from Croc's jaws, down his throat. It was like watching something out of National Wildlife as a very noticeable bulge traveled down the front of Croc's throat, and disappeared into his toned chest. "Wow, that was...impressive..." Chase said, almost forgetting that same mouthful of chicken could have very easily been him had this truck not been here.

Licking his lips, Croc grinned toothily as he rubbed his stomach in satisfaction. "Tasty," he exclaimed as he proceeded to grab another chicken, more than eager to sink his teeth into it. As he ripped the plastic top off with ease, he looked down at Chase and sharply said, "Alright, you're off the hook, Tiny. Now scram before I change my mind!" Ordinarily, Chase would have been more than happy to take his leave from the terrifying Croc man about to eat an entire truckload of groceries and miscellaneous goods, unfortunately, the young blond's situation didn't fare any better outside the warehouse. Croc was about to toss the chicken into his mouth, but he noticed Chase shiftily still standing around with an uncertain look on his face. "Are you deaf?" Croc barked in annoyance. "I said get lost!"

Chase tugged nervously at the top of his shirt. "I-I know, sir, but...well, those guys are still out there, looking for me, and if they find me-"

"Not my problem," Croc said coldly. "Maybe you can go ask the Batman to help you," he added almost sarcastically. He was just about to shove the next chicken into his mouth, when Chase responded.

"It's just that, well, sir, I-I know if I'm at least here with you, I'm safe from those lunatics."

Croc immediately stopped, and looked back down at Chase, almost astonished by that last part. Immediately, he snorted and raised what would be his eyebrow if he had any. "You realize if I'm still hungry after this, I'll probably just eat YOU, right?" He asked, still a little baffled. Chase nodded nervously, then; much to Croc's surprise, said, "I'm willing to take that chance, Mister Killer Croc...sir."

A moment of silence passed as Croc almost laughed to himself. This was definitely a first.

Finally, Croc rolled his eyes and said, "If you insist." He was about to once again shove the chicken into his cavernous jaw, when the teens' stomach once again proceeded to growl audibly. Chase's face went red a bit as he laughed nervously and said, "Sorry, guess I'm still pretty hungry. I mean that is what got me in this mess in the first place."

With an annoyed grunt, Croc shook his head and, much to Chase's surprise, pointed towards the other items up for grabs and said, "Have at it." Chase looked up at Croc in surprise. "Really?"

"There's plenty to go around, it's not like you humans eat that much anyway. Besides, if I AM still hungry, I want my dinner nice and bloated, not skin and bone." Chase went wide eyed as Croc looked down at him almost menacingly, but nonetheless, Chase nodded and grabbed whatever looked appetizing from the truck. As he set his food down, he watched Croc slide his second whole chicken into his mouth, and once again, proceeded to chew voraciously. As Croc proceeded to gulp down the second chicken, Chase looked almost impressed. On one hand, it was horrifying to think what else he could put away, but on the other hand, it was pretty damn cool. Watching Croc eat was like watching a Boa swallow a Boar whole, he gulped down what could feed an entire family of five for dinner, in one go, as if it were a piece of candy.

As Croc savored the flavor, Chase decided to try and sate his own hunger. He grabbed a frozen family serving of Chicken Alfredo Pasta. He would have happily eaten it cold, but that probably wouldn't have tasted too great. So he got up and checked the lounge room, where he; to his relief, discovered a microwave. Unplugging it, he carried it off near the truck where Croc was now shoving handfuls of raw meat into his mouth, and plugged it in. "Figured you'd prefer this over the cold stuff," Chase noted. Croc shook his head. "Food is food. Unlike you humans, I'm not picky." As if to emphasize his point, Croc a 9 pound frozen salmon, and slid the whole thing into his mouth, where he proceeded to greedily chew away.

While the concept of eating frozen fish was morbidly horrible to Chase and any rational person, it was still a side to behold, watching Croc put away 9 whole pounds of fish and still eat at the same pace he was already eating. He then proceeded to warm up his own meal, and continued to watch Croc eat and eat.

As Croc continued to consume ample amounts of food with no stop in sight, Chase's eyes soon wandered down to Croc's stomach. Any ordinary person's stomach would be blimping out right about now, but a giant beast like Croc? He had eaten well over 30 pounds of food at this point, and his stomach only now just began to slightly push outward, and Croc was still eating like he hadn't eaten in ages.

Chase was so mesmerized by the sight, he had forgotten about his own meal, until Croc gulped down a mouthful of raw sausages, and turned his attention towards Chase, looking mildly annoyed as the microwave continued beeping off. "Either take the damn pasta outta the microwave, or I'm chucking it against a wall," he threatened.

Chase snapped back to reality, and promptly took the still piping hot pasta from the microwave. Blowing on it, he grabbed a fork and wasted no time hungrily digging into the whole thing. Croc saw the sight and smirked to himself before turning his attention back to his feast. The two ravenously ate as time went on.
142332121.title: Everything was there, just like Chase said it was.

choices: Both continue their feeding frenzy unimpeded
They take a break after a while.
1423321212.content:
Chase loaded his plastic fork with as much pasta and chicken as he could fit and stuffed that fork into his mouth with haste. He had told Croc that the whole reason he was in this mess with the crazed gangsters was because he tried to steal food from them. What he hadn't told Croc was that; like him, he too hadn't eaten in over a few days.

In fact, the young man had literally been dying of starvation and thirst before making his way to this warehouse and getting just enough sustenance to run for his life when they found him. He had recently been one of the few surviving victims of a series of bombings committed by the Calender Man just a few days prior; the Fourth of July...in which Calender Man decided to rig an entire neighborhood to blow. Chase's apartment had been bombed to cinder, leaving him with absolutely nothing, and no friends or family to turn to, as his own parents had long since abandoned him as a child.

He wasn't one for begging, especially in a city this rotten, and since GCPD was so tied up trying to apprehend Calender Man to do anything for his victims, Chase had to make do. And this is where that got him.

But at this moment in time, he could care less. That immediate satisfaction of filling his dangerously empty stomach with anything made his problems all but fade away, if at least for now. And so, he stuffed one bite after another into his mouth, chewing rapidly, gulping quickly and going right back for more. Not unlike how Croc was faring with much larger servings of food all at once.

Occasionally, Chase would glance over to see how the big reptilian man was doing, and like before, he found himself enticed watching him continue to put away so much so ravenously. Again, his eyes wandered down to Croc's belly, which had begun to push outward more noticeably over the tried waistband of the beasts old, raggedy pants. But it hadn't slowed him down in the slightest.

Eventually, Chase had reached the halfway point of his Chicken Alfredo Pasta. Starving or not, it was quite a heavy meal, clearly not meant for just one person, as Chase's stomach was already feeling uncomfortably bloated. He lowered his fork and rested a hand atop his stomach to inspect the damage. It was pushing outward by about an inch or two more than it would under normal circumstances, and there was a tightness brewing, which caused him some mild discomfort.

Munching on an entire box of cookies, (literally, he just stuffed the actual unopened box into his mouth) Croc looked down at Chase and, with his mouthful, muttered, "What's the matter? Full already?" For some reason, Chase didn't want to look weak around Croc. He couldn't explain it, but despite how much he feared him, he sought Croc's approval. And seeing how Croc's own stomach began to noticeably bulge, more so than his own, he decided to lie and said, "Err, nope. Just, savoring the flavor. Like I said, it's been a while." Croc shrugged to himself and gulped down his mouthful of cookies (and cardboard), then grabbed more miscellaneous goods which he promptly stuffed into his mouth.

Chase grabbed his fork yet again, and; despite his fullness, resumed stuffing more pasta into his mouth, determined to finish the entire thing. His stomach continued to push further, growing ever more uncomfortable the more bloated it became as it pushed against his shirt. Finally, somehow, Chase managed to swallow the last bit of pasta from the tin tray. Leaning back, he rubbed his bulging belly and burped loudly, covering his mouth immediately, in fear of annoying Croc. "Sorry!" Chase said apologetically as he stifled a second burp and muttered another apology.

Croc chuckled to himself and shook his head. "Hey, your stomach's gotta make room somehow, right?" As if to prove his point, Croc thumped his belly and let out easily the loudest belch Chase had ever heard. He then smacked his lips and continued to stuff his face.

Chase couldn't help but smile at the display of piggishness. Perhaps, because it made Croc seem less intimidating than before, or because Croc was seeming and acting less hostile, and thus, made it seem less likely he would devour Chase. But whatever the reason, Chase was undeniably fascinated by the creature, and especially with watching him eat. For some reason, Chase didn't want this little feeding frenzy to come to a close.

He wanted to see how much this beast could truly put away, and how big his stomach could possibly get. And if that meant stuffing his own face beyond his limited means, so be it. Even if those thugs outside weren't about to brutally murder Chase the second he saw them, he still didn't want to leave.

And so, after coaxing out a few more rather loud burps to clear up as much space in his stomach as he could, Chase grabbed a frozen BBQ Pizza and warmed it up. After letting it cool off, he proceeded to stuff one of his eight slices into his mouth, taking a large bite and chewing voraciously, before gulping it down and biting again.

One down, seven more to go.
1423321212.title: Chase finishes and continues eating with Croc.

choices: The two continue to stuff their faces
Chase offers to rub Croc's belly
14233212122.content:
Chase chomped away, one slice of pizza after another. Each bite already well past his capacity, but he intended to see how far he could go to keep up with Croc, who was still tearing into the trucks supplies rapidly. Occasionally, Chase would glance back at the monstrous reptile swallowing entire items whole, watching them create a large bulge down his throat, and disappear into his toned chest, and eventually, drop right into Croc's quickly growing belly.

As Chase's eyes wandered down to the beasts' incredibly bloated stomach, he would then stop eating and just, gaze at the appendage in awe. The scaly stomach looked as though it were a rapidly growing balloon, bloating outward past the waistband of Croc's rags as he began to hunch over from its steadily overwhelming size.

"...I don't think I've ever seen anything eat that much before..." muttered Chase, impressed and in awe. Hearing that, Croc turned his attention to Chase and grinned wickedly as he said, "You ain't seen nothing yet," and proceeded to stuff an entire frozen ham down his throat, gulping it down in mere seconds, before smacking his lips and grabbing another.

Following his example, Chase continued to stuff his face with more pizza, taking larger bites, as though inspired by Croc's gluttonous display. As Chase continued, his own belly began to peak outward from the bottom of his shirt, exposing some of his normally trim stomach, now painfully bloated by a good few inches. Almost on reflex, Chase started rubbing his stomach gingerly in an effort to ease the strain while he continued to slowly put away more and more pizza, until; at long last, the BBQ pizza box was all but completely emptied out.

Sighing from exhaustion, Chase leaned back and ran his against against his aching belly. To his surprise, he heard an audible groaning from Croc, who also; had sat down and began running his clawed hand around his ridiculously swollen belly, licking his scaly lips as he did.

"Mmmmmm, y'know something? It's been a looooong time since I've eaten this good," Croc muttered happily, enjoying the satisfied feeling of vague fullness. Chase simply nodded with agreement and said, "You said it, Mister Croc! I literally haven't eaten in days! I can't even begin to tell you how much I needed this!" Earning Croc's attention, Croc raised what would be his eyebrow at Chase's progress, as though he were semi impressed with the young human.

"Heh, didn't think a scrawny little twig like you could actually keep up with me," Croc said, pleasantly surprised. Chase rubbed the back of his head bashfully and said, "To be perfectly fair though, I probably couldn't have if I weren't so incredibly hungry!"

Then, a loud, sudden gurgle rumbled out from Croc's bulbous belly. Chase glanced up as Croc proceeded to pound his fist against his toned chest a few times, and then let out a huge, thundering belch, reverberating loudly all around the walls of the warehouse. Croc smacked his lips and gave his belly a good, proud slap as his tongue hung out from the side of his mouth. Chase, much to his own surprise, began to laugh heartily.

"Nice one!" he exclaimed happily at Croc, who glanced back at the younger man and said, "That was nothing. Just making a little bit of room before I feed some more." And as if following by Croc's example, Chase thumped a fist against his bloated stomach and immediately let out a huge burp after.

*UUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRP!!!*

After the lengthy eruption ended, Chase sighed with relief as Croc glanced over at him and chuckled, in a surprisingly not-cold tone.

"Hehe, not bad, little guy," Croc exclaimed, almost impressed with the younger man. Letting out a smaller burp, Chase smiled almost proudly and shrugged. "Like you said, gotta make room somehow, right?" Chase exclaimed, patting his belly for emphasis.

"You know something, kid? For a pitiful little human morsel, you're alright..." said the monster, almost sounding pleasantly surprised when he did. Shocked to hear any kind of praise from the beast, Chase smiled and said, "T-thanks!" And despite his better judgement, he himself continued to say, "And, f-for a frightening, man eating Crocodile Man, y-you're really cool!"

To Chase's relief, Croc actually chuckled at the remark, almost appreciative, rather than malicious sounding.

Afterwards...
14233212122.title: They take a break after a while.

choices: They continue to eat until a majority of the food is gone.
They eat for a while and call it quits for the day.
142332121222.content:
Chase watched as Croc rested his clawed hand against his bloated stomach, rubbing it firmly in an effort to coax away whatever tension had built up within it since his gluttonous escapades had begun. His curiosity was already beyond peaked, and so; despite his better judgement, he still cautiously approached the scaly beast of a man and asked, "Say, Mister Croc...?"

Croc looked down at Chase and grunted, "Just Croc. None of this 'Mister' crap, got it?"

Immediately, Chase nodded. "Y-yes, sir! Err, well, Croc?"

"What is it?"

"You kind of look like you're suffering from something of a bellyache, am I right?"

Croc again grunted as he glanced down at his bloated abdomen and replied, "Nothin' I ain't gotten over before."

"Well, if you want, I could, maybe, make you feel better."

"How?" demanded Croc. To which, Chase said nothing, but instead, walked over to the still kneeling monster and, pressed both his hands gently atop Croc's bloated stomach. Part of Chase was terrified, only imagining how many times this dreadful somach had digested something more than just raw meat and groceries. But he forced himself to push those thoughts out from his mind, and instead, began to rub all against Croc's scaly belly, slowly and soothingly.

Croc's eyelids immediately widened as he hung his head back and smiled an almost goofy smile as he did so. "Ohhh yeah, there we go..." muttered a blissful Croc as Chase smiled semi-nervously and continued.

His nervousness soon faded as he too, began to smile as he gingerly rubbed the croc man's stomach with both hands, enjoying the coolness emanating from the monsters scaly belly, and the tightness of his currently rounded stomach. He couldn't fathom how large the beast had become, and how much was currently being packed away within his troubled gullet. All Chase knew, was that he wanted to see more in this Croc's belly. He wanted to see it get bigger and bigger.

Croc; on the other hand, was in heaven. His salivating tongue stuck out from the side of his crooked jaw as he leaned back on his elbows, letting his belly stick upward for Chase to continue to gently massage all over.

In addition to which, Chase's gentle massaging had unknotted a lot of Croc's stomach muscles, and in the process, stirred up a lot of the pent up gas resonating within his gullet. Feeling it rising to the surface, Chase proceeded to take a hold of Croc's belly from both sides and gently but firmly push down on Croc's stomach, forcing up a huge, lengthy belch.

Laughing a bit nervously, Chase glanced up at Croc and said, "Eh, sorry, didn't mean to-"

Croc shook his head and smiled himself. "You kidding? That felt great! Do it again!"

Surprised, Chase nonetheless smiled and more than willingly complied. He rubbed around Croc's belly a little more firmly until he felt some gas tensing up Croc's stomach, and once again, pushed, forcing up another massive belch from the beast. Without even needing to be asked, Chase pressed his hands up against the front of Croc's belly, just above his belly button and a bit more firmly than before, shoved deep against Croc's bloated belly.

The resulting belch was so fierce that it nearly blew Chase away as it blasted the air for several seconds straight before coming to an end. Immediately, Chase burst into a fit of laughter. "Holy crap, that was awesome!" he exclaimed almost gleefully. Croc grinned proudly and said, "Like that, eh, little guy?" Chase immediately nodded, still laughing and said, "Seriously, man, those were amazing! I didn't think ANYONE could ever burp like that!" Croc simply shrugged humbly and replied, "How many people you know who can eat anywhere near as much as I can?"

"Fair point, fair point," Chase added, patting Croc's belly in agreement. Suddenly, both their bloated stomachs rumbled. In that instant, the two resumed stuffing their faces...

14333221.content:
"You better have a good reason for calling this meeting, Rogers, because if it's anything less than a world-wide alien invasion I swea-"

         "Good morning to you too, Tony." Steve Rogers, said to the disgruntled billionaire superhero, "Have a doughnut to go with that coffee of yours." The super soldier said as he pushed the pink box of pastries towards Tony's seat.

         "Mmmh." Tony grumbled as he took his seat at the team's meeting table at Avenger's Tower. He was the last member of the team to arrive: Clint Barton (Hawkeye), Thor, The Hulk, Falcon (Sam Wilson), Logan Howlett (Wolverine) and the newest recruit Peter Parker (Spider-Man), were all gathered around the circular table. Each had a few doughnuts of their own, save for Thor and The Hulk, who had couple dozen all to themselves.

         "So," Tony said before biting into a glazed doughnut, "Wat's da pwobwem?" Tony asked as he chewed, swallowing before speaking again, "Is Dr. Doom building a new doomsday weapon in the Latverian Embassy or do we need to help Spider-Kid over here find a date to the prom?"

         The other Avengers chuckles but the frown on Peter's lower face, which was exposed to scarf down a few doughnuts, was clearly not happy; and neither was Cap.

         "Were here," Captain America started, "Because theres a new supervillain in town and so far law enforcement hasn't been able to stop him." Steve pressed a button on the table, activating the holographic display device in the middle, which displayed security footage from a bank. "So far all of his robberies have been monetary - banks, jewelry stores, pawn shops, etc, but the security cameras always cut out right before he uses his powers."

         The Avengers all watched as the video displayed security footage of a quiet bank, a few seconds went by, and then the criminal stepped into view and then the cameras cut out. Steve hit fast-forward and then play once the security feed kicked back in; the villain gone and every male on screen, including the security guards and bank tellers, had huge, swollen, bloated bellies. Steve hit a few more buttons, which brought up the same footage from a different camera, and paused just as the man walked in. His costume was red and skin tight, showing off his cut, muscular body, with a big white F on his chest. His boots and gloves were white, his mask covering his whole head with a white streak down the middle, and he has multiple small spikes along the shoulders and on the toes of the boots.

         "What's the F stand for? Freak?" Clint asked as he scarfed down another doughnut.

         "No clue yet. All we know about him is that he causes no damage, he always makes a clean getaway, and he leaves those in the building completely stuffed." Cap replied.

         "Not everyone; just the men." Sam pointed out.

         "So then why call a meeting of the boy's club?" Tony asked.

         "I agree with the Man of Iron," Thor exclaimed, "Surely out female companions would fair better against this Red-Man!"

         "All of the female Avengers are already on missions," Cap explained, "So it's just us. If any of you run into him while on patrol be careful - we don't know the extent of his powers."

         After that Steve dismissed the meeting and all the Avengers went their separate ways.

-----------------

         Two-and-a-half hours later Hawkeye was out in Manhattan on his patrol shift. The blonde archer had picked some lunch, four hot dogs from the best street vendor in town, load with the works, a bag of chips, and a large soda. Hawkeye shoved the last bite of his fourth hot dog into his mouth, chewing thoughtfully before swallowing and washing it down with what remained of his soda. The hero set the trash next to him and patted his belly, letting out a small burp.

         "Oof... over did it a bit." Clint said, patting his slightly bloated belly, which stretched the fabric of his skin tight uniform slightly. "Ah, well, no biggie. I'm parked in front of the only bank this F guy hasn't hit in Manhattan yet. If he strikes here I'll be ready to go."

         About twenty minutes went by when Clint finally spotted the man clad in red enter the bank. The archer stood up, his belly still bloated from his lunch, and launched a rope-arrow above the doorway. Hawkeye swung down, kicking open the door as he entered, and did a roll before landing square on his feet, an arrow aimed right at the man's back, "Okay, stop sign, hands up!"

         The mysterious villain stood there, silent, but it was what was happening around him that made Clint double take. The female bank tellers were loading up bags full of money, the female customers were all off to the side silently watching, but this superpowered criminal was using his powers on the men. Every man in the room; the manager, bank tellers, the male customers, and the security guards, were all stuffing their faces with food that had been piled around them. Soda poured out from multiple kegs, splitting off into thinner streams and flowing right down the men's throats, while doughnuts flew directly to the other men's mouths, being gobbled with delight.

         "What the...," Hawkeye said, distracted, before turning back to the villain, who had turned around to face Hawkeye, "Alright, who are you?!"

         "I was wondering how long it would take for The Avengers to notice me. I was hoping to run into Thor first but you'll do." The villain said.

         "Who. Are. You." Hawkeye repeated, arrow at the ready.

         "You can call me The Feeder." The man said, and though his face was covered, Clint could tell he was smirking. "I can tell by that bloated belly of yours you just had lunch," The Feeder sniffed the air and chuckled, "Four hot dogs, the works, some chips and a soda. Sounds tasty."

         "How did yo-" Hawkeye shook his head, focusing, and furrowed his brow, "Listen, you can either go down the easy way or the hard way, food boy. Which will it be?"

         "The easy way wouldn't be any fun, would it?" The Feeder asked.

         Without a second thought Hawkeye fired his arrow, and in a split second, had re-loaded and fired two more. As the arrows whizzed towards The Feeder he waved his arm in front of him and the 3 arrows stuck into the wall - a jelly filled doughnut on each tip. Hawkeye soon found himself being pelted by pastries. The hero ran to the side, dodging a wall of bear claws that flew towards him, only to be hit on the side by a wave of apple fritters. The hero hit the wall near the door entrance, buried in sticky, glazed confections, and before he could do anything to get up, he found an apple fritter being forced into his mouth.

         The feeder approached him, various doughnuts floating above one hand, and as the last bit of apple fritter was forced down Hawkeye's throat, a raspberry filled jelly doughnut followed. Hawkeye tried to fight it but the doughnuts kept coming, one after another being forced into his belly, until they suddenly stopped after six. Hawkeye, despite the heavy weight in his stomach, broke his arms free and tried to reach an arrow, but both muscular arms became pinned to the wall under the weight of a dozens of doughnuts.

         "What's the matter, Hawkeye," The Feeder said as he lifted up his mask to just under his nose, "You can't be full yet? Why don't you relax and have a bite to eat?" The Feeder's voice reverberated through the air, echoing off the ways in an almost melodic way. Hawkeye's eyes flashed red for a brief second, and as the pastries pinning his arms to the walls fell to the floor, the archer grabbed the first doughnut he could and shoved it into his mouth. The Feeder grinned, lowering his mask over his face again before turning around and walking towards the back.

         "Is all the money in the truck?" The Feeder asked a female employee who unlocked the security doors for him.

         "Yes, sir." The hypnotized bank teller replied, and The Feeder smiled.

         "Perfect. I'll be on my way; you can reactivate the security cameras once all the food is gone and you've disposed of the containers." The Feeder was then escorted out the back to the armored truck that was waiting for him. He changed from his costume to that of a security guard, placed a hat over his mohawk, and grinned as he loaded into the truck's cab, "Eat up, Hawkeye. There's be plenty more where that came from." He said before driving off - blending into New York traffic.

         Back inside the bank the men were stuffing themselves, though several had stopped once reaching their limit. Doughnuts and soda flowed down their throats and Hawkeye was shoving as many as he could into his belly, before finally swallowing the last glazed doughnut that was part of the pile he was trapped under. Hawkeye groaned, 5 dozen doughnuts crammed into his tight belly - his abs stretched tight along on the pale sphere that had broken through the fabric of his costume. The archer's eyes flashed red once more before he laid his head back and passed out against the wall.

         The room was cleared of all food evidence, the cameras turned back on, and everyone who wasn't out like a light realized they had all lost a half-hour and none of them could remember a thing.
14333221.title: The Adipose Avengers!

143332211.content:
Everyone stood around the bed they'd confined Hawkeye to. Nodes were attached to him with wires leading to various computers and machines making beeps while lights flashed. He was pretty sure Tony hooked him up to stuff that didn't even do diagnostics just because he could. The guys were all silent, not really sure what to say. They were really just waiting for Tony to say that he was okay and going to be fine in a day or so.

"Well, he's fine," Tony started. Everyone's eyes went to the man as he sat at a screen, scanning his eyes across readings. "But he's not going to be fine."

"What?!" Clint yelled, trying to bolt upright but Steve pushed him back down.

Bruce shook his head at Tony, "What do you mean he's not going to be fine? All those readings I saw said he wasn't in any danger."

Tony flipped his screen around and tapped a pen to a few numbers. It all looked like nonsense but he was pretty confident about what he was about to say so everyone went quiet again to listen. Clint did look to be in perfect health other than some recent weight gain. In fact, he seemed like he was back to full strength. He was eating more than when he first arrived and his vitals were back to normal, too. There was no way he was in trouble.

"This is his weight here," Tony said, pointing to a chart with a red line ticking upward. "Compared to his metabolism." He pointed to a blue section that was rather erratic. "He's gaining weight like crazy. He came in with that food baby but after digesting it his body converted it to fat and mass. And it's not just from what that weirdo fed him either. It's all food. I had Jarvis make up a special liquid diet for out buddy here that only contained the calories and nutrients vital to keep him alive."

"Gee, thanks," Hawkeye mumbled, everyone glaring at him to shut up as they were rapt with attention to Tony's assessment.

Ironman gave Clint a look before looking back to the group, "He still gained weight. I don't know how, hell, Jarvis doesn't know how! Something's going on in his body and I have no idea how to stop it."

Thor looked around the room and then to their workout area a few floors below, "He can do those work outs you humans are so very fond of, could he not?"

Tony shook his head, tapping the screen again, "Jarvis ran some simulations. Based on his body's current state, the rate of growth, and the fact that he's not losing muscle mass as he gets fatter we came to the conclusion that he'll just continue growing no matter how much he tries to lose weight."

"What... what do you mean? That I'm stuck like this?" Clint asked, craning his neck a bit to look at Tony who had turned the screen back around and was tapping away at a second screen.

"Eh, maybe. Though, to be honest, Jarvis' simulations concluded you could probably get up over a thousand pounds and still be totally mobile as your muscle mass is growing, too."

Peter finally piped up, shaking his head, "Wait, that doesn't make sense." Everyone turned to the kid who blinked and refocused. It was weird seeing all the adults looking to him. "What I mean is, if this guy is fattening guys up wouldn't he also want to get rid of their strength? You know, make us unable to go after him? Seems like he either didn't think this through or is toying with us."

"Well, only one way to-" started Tony, cut off by all his screens going red and a few switching over to a map. "Fun. He's back. Security cameras caught him downtown at that big jewelry store. Let's send a small team out this time to see if we can overpower him."

So the team sent out...
143332211.title: The team talks to Hawkeye as he recovers back a...

choices: Peter and Steve recover back at the tower.
1433322112.content:
"Good idea Tony. Let's se-"

"I'm on it!" Spider-Man exclaimed, interrupting Cap before running off out of the medical wing.

"KID, WAIT!" Captain America shouted back before sighing.

"Want me to come with?" Wolverine asked, "I know the wall-crawler can be a bit headstrong."

"And so can you," Steve replied, "I appreciate the offer Logan but he and I should be enough." Cap pulled his mask over his head and ran off after Peter.

As Captain America ran off all eyes were turned back to Clint, who was still growing. The once lean-but-toned Archer was lying on the bed, stripped down to his purple, arrow patterned briefs, and was doing his best not to move so the tests would work. He had already gained about 75 pounds and his weight was slowly increasing. His once defined pecs and arms were now thicker and softer, their definition slowly vanishing under layers of fat, and his once cut abs had ben replaced with a doughy ball of pale flesh. His briefs were digging into his fleshier hips just slightly and his beefy thighs were growing along with the rest of his now chubbier body. Despite all the fat Clint had gained the archer did seem more muscular - his torso was wider, his arms bigger, he had a thicker neck and more defined traps, and his thighs seemed stronger.

"So do we have any idea of this guy's powers are?" Sam asked, turning to Tony and Bruce.

"Not exactly," Bruce stated, "We know that he somehow altered Clint's body so that his metabolism would go wack. His body is digesting food at an alarming rate but it's converting everything he eats into fat and mass. Clint, are you sure you don't remember what happened?"

"No, it's all a blur..." Clint replied, squinting into the distance, "WAIT! No, I'm starting to remember... I entered the bank and there doughnuts... everywhere; big kegs of soda, too. All the men were stuffing their faces it was like... like they wanted to keep eating. None of them were resisting. He.. he calls himself The Feeder. He can manipulate food; he used doughnuts to deflect my arrows and pin me to the wall. It's... it's all fuzzy after that."

"It's okay, Clint, it's not your fault." Sam said, reassuring his fellow Avenger.

"Yeah, but until we can stop your weight gain you can't eat any actual food." Tony said, "The liquid diet Jarvis created for you will still make you gain weight but not as rapidly. You're gonna keep getting bigger until we stop him or whatever it is he's doing to you."

"He sounds like a mutant to me." Wolverine chimed in, crossing his arms.

"I agree," Bruce and Tony said simultaneously. Bruce turned back to Clint, who already seemed have gained another 5 pounds, "At any rate, try and get some rest, Clint. Tony and I'll stay up all night if we have to cure you."

"Thanks, guys." The expanding archer said as he felt his body growing fatter by the minute.

------------------------------------

The scene inside of the jewelry store was exactly like the bank - the female employees at the store were putting every piece of jewelry they had into bags while the men were all shoving as much food into their mouths as they could. Buttons on dress shirt had popped off and seams had torn but the men kept filling their guts with doughnuts and soda. The Feeder stood there, arms crossed as he watched happily as his heist unfolded perfectly.

"I hope you brought enough for the entire class." A voice said behind him. The Feeder turned around just in time to receive a hard punch to his face, sending him flying back into a pile of cream filled doughnuts. The villain shook his head, rubbing his jaw as he looked up to see the red-and-blue wall-crawler standing near the entrance of the store.

"Spider-Man," The Feeder said in a cheerful tone, "I'm surprised they sent the new guy in to fight me. What, was Captain America busy?"

"Actually, he's on his way." Spidey said in his usual, sarcastic tone, "but I'm afraid the all-you-can-steal jewelry buffet is closed for you." Spidey launched several webs at the villain, who quickly backflipped out of the pile and landed near a display case.

"I don't think so, web-head. In fact, I'm just getting STARTED!" With a wave of his hand a few dozen doughnuts flew across the room directly at Spidey. Thanks to his Spidey-sense the wall-crawler was able to dodge several wave of doughnuts using a combination of flips and quick web-shots, but it was landing on a cream-filled doughnut that caused him to slip and land flat on his back that was his downfall. The Feeder piled on dozens of doughnuts onto Spider-Man's body, pinning him down to the floor. Spidey struggled to get free but it was no use - The Feeder's ability to manipulate food was what was really holding the teen hero does.

"Y'know, Spidey, I always did think you were far too skinny for your own good." The Feeder said as he approached Spider-Man, kneeling down and reaching for his mask. Spidey pulled away and The Feeder chuckled, "OH, don't worry, web-head. I'm not interested in your secret identity - I just wanna plump you up like I did your archer buddy." After lifting up Spider-Man's mask so his mouth was free, The Feeder did the same to his own mask. A glazed doughnut hovered just above Spidey's mouth and a wicked smirk spread across The Feeder's face.

"Now, eat up." The Feeder said, his voice echoing off the walls in an almost hypnotic way. Spidey's eyes flashed red for a brief second behind his mask just as the doughnut was crammed down his throat. The Feeder stood up, moving the pile of doughnuts off of Spidey's body and watched with a smug sense of satisfaction as the web-slinger got to his knees and started shoving the fattening pastries down his throat.

"Load up the truck!" The Feeder said to the female employees under his trance, "Once I deal with Cap I'm out of here." As if on cue the sound of a motorcycle's engine roared as Cap's bike burst through the double doors and skidded into place fifteen feet from The Feeder's position.

Cap assessed the situation quickly; Spider-Man had already been taken down, the store had been picked clean, and the man responsible for it all was right in front of him. Without a word Cap leapt from his bike and tossed his shield before sprinting at the man. The Feeder dodged the super solider's signature shield and only had a second before he found himself in hand-to-hand combat with the famous hero. Both Cap and The Feeder dodged, ducked, and deflected each other's kicks and punches; Cap catching his shield all in the middle of it. The Feeder deflected a hit and used that as an opportunity to get some distance between him and the solider.

"What did you do to Spider-Man and Hawkeye!" Captain America shouted, using the small break to try and get some info.

"It's nice to meet you too, Cap." The Feeder said sarcastically, his mask still lifted up to reveal his mouth.

"What did you do to them?" Cap repeated.

"Me? Not much, all I did was suggest they have a snack." The Feeder replied.

"Hypnotism?" Cap asked, never breaking eye contact with the villain.

"No, I'm just very... persuasive." The red and white villain said before a wave of Boston Cream Doughnuts flew directly at Cap. Cap used his shield to protect himself, the confections splattering against the vibranium shield on impact. The soldier held his ground, but the force soon picked up and knocked him back. 3 doughnuts crammed themselves into Cap's mouth, forcing their way down his throat before another 3 took their place.

"Enjoy your lunch." The Feeder said as he walked towards the back of the store where his truck was waiting. The villain's melodic voice echoed off the walls, penetrating Cap's ears and causing him to grow insatiably hungry. His eye flashed red for a brief second and, just like Spider-Man, the patriotic superhero found himself eating as much food as he possibly could fit into his gut.

The men in the store had already passed out, bellies swollen and stuffed with food, but Spider-Man and Cap continued to eat - their bellies bloating with each bite and stretching the fabric of their suits to their limits. Once The Feeder had made his escape the female employees cleared out the mess, save for the doughnuts Cap and Spidey were still eating, and the security cameras were back online.

----------------------------------------

"The cameras are back on!" Sam said, poking his head into the medical, "and it isn't good."

"What happened?" Thor asked.

"He got to Cap and Spidey." Sam replied.

Tony pulled up the security feed on one of his holographic screens and the team watched as Spidey fell to his back, his suit torn open and 6 dozen doughnuts crammed into his gut, while Cap kept sat on the other end of the screen, still stuffing his face.

"They're... willing eating?" Wolverine asked, surprised.

"It looks that way. Maybe that's why you ate so much, Clint; You couldn't stop yourself." Bruce mentioned.

"Regardless, The Feeder escaped again and we've got two more teammates we need to go pick up." Tony said to the team.
1433322112.title: Spidey and Cap VS. The Feeder

14333221121.content:
A few hours later a couple more beds were added to the room next to Clint. They held Peter and Steve who were in much the same position as the archer. Both lay there with their bodies rapidly digesting and converting the food into fat and mass while Tony tried to slow it down with the liquid diet he had given Clint. Sam and Thor stood off to the side feeling a little worried. This new villain had come from nowhere and had taken out three of their teammates without even trying. From what they could gather, the guys WANTED to eat. That lead to a new thought: what if they couldn't stop this guy? If what Tony said was true, they could end up fatter than the Guinness World Record fat men!

"Well, it's slower. But they're still growing. We're going to have to do this some other way. Brute force isn't going to work but we don't know where this guy is! And the two best suited to stealth are..." Tony said, looking at those lying on the beds.

"Perhaps this man has some sort of powerful magic. Have you considered that, Man of Iron?" Thor said, thick arms crossed across his big chest.

Tony rolled his eyes and sat back down at the computers, Bruce looking over his shoulder. "If it is magic then you should be able to stop it by hitting it with a hammer, right?" he said sarcastically.

"It may be possible. It is possibly simple mortal magic that cannot compare to that of me and my kin!" Thor grinned.

Sam shrugged his shoulders, looking from Thor to the scientists, "Worth a shot, right? If he is using magic it's none of the alien stuff we know of. Maybe it's just simple hypnotism."

"Sir," Jarvis chimed in, making everyone turn to look at Tony's screen. "I believe I have found something of interest to you and the gentlemen."

"Yes, yes, what is it Jarvis?!" Tony said, urging the AI to hurry.

"The armored truck from the bank and the one from the jewelry store. They have been spotted. Warehouse 12, Pier 45. Police reports say there is motion inside but they cannot get in without a warrant. Reports also list that the landlord says only that the tenant currently utilizing the space paid for the entire year up front. Perhaps it would be good to begin there, sir?" he said.

The group nodded and looked over at Thor. They agreed he would be the next one to try and take this guy on. If it was magic, he would know best how to counter it. If not, he had the strength to fight it and the Feeder. Though based on their previous encounters they knew to be careful.
